characters: ON THE SURFACE OF THE WATER
ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE GLASS DOORS
BACK TO SCENE, IN THE BENTLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stately mansion.  A perfect lawn.  A BUTLER carries a  birthday cake with sparking sparklers... Past wealthy MEN in crewcuts and thin ties, WOMEN in cat- sunglasses.  Everyone sings (silent) "Happy Birthday"... CHILDREN follow the cake, in dresses and suits, gathering round NICHOLAS VAN ORTON, 7, guest of honor, who wears a  blindfold.  MOTHER comes to remove the blindfold and Nich ogles the cake, laughs.  He reaches for a sparkler. STEP PRINT: Mother intercepts, fussing, fixing his hair.. Nicholas' FATHER sits near, smoking, nodding.  He's inten thin, wearing a party hat.  He notices the camera without mugging for it, bends to snuff his cigarette in an ashtra SPLICE-JUMP TO/STEP PRINT: a Harlequin CLOWN ties balloon animals.  Nicholas assists, distracted by the inattentive children who look into the camera and pull hair and stand their chairs... Men are drinking, storytelling, laughing.  A fraternity.. The women are elsewhere, doing movie-vamp poses for the  camera, blowing cigarette smoke, brightly dressed, eyelid blue and green, lipstick perfect... Servants clear the table.  Father holds a piece of untouc cake.  A man talks to him, but Father stares off, lost in thought.  He's forgotten the party hat on his head... STEP PRINT: Mother puts her arms around Father and makes face the camera.  He leans in, posing dutifully. SPLICE-JUMP TO: a nanny in uniform, ILSA, holds an INFANT (CONRAD) to the camera, places the baby in Nicholas' arms STEP PRINT: Nicholas is gentle, overwhelmed by cradling h tiny brother. SPLICE-JUMP TO: children play tag.  Across the lawn, Fath heads to the house.  He looks back, walks backwards. STEP PRINT: he gives a small wave, continuing away... Kids chase past.  Nicholas and two other kids huddle, arm locked, spinning round and round, till they stumble diffe directions, falling, laughing, dizzy...
Nicholas gets up, wearing a PUPPET on each hand. STEP PRINT: He walks CLOSE and peers in the camera, steps back, happily talking.  We can't hear because it's SILENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The emotionless face of NICHOLAS VAN ORTON, just today 40 looks upon itself in a mirror.  He brings an electric sha across his chin, shuts it off, wipes his face with a towe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas crosses.  The bedroom is spacious, devoid of clu A weight-machine in a far corner.  A big T.V.  shows CNN  with no sound. At a bedside table, Nicholas picks up a heavy, gold ROLEX sliding it on, checking the time.  6:32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas stands at the kitchen island his tie thrown over his shoulder, eating breakfast.  ILSA, now elderly, is ac the way doing dishes. The only sounds are the tiny clicks of Nicholas' knife an fork against his plate.  He's reading a German newspaper. Nicholas jabs the last piece of egg, skewers the last bit ham and last square of toast.  Plate's clean. He sips his last swallow of juice, dabs his mouth with a  napkin, picks up his briefcase and heads to a back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a nice day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas walks down a garden pathway to a three-car garag He looks at his Rolex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bentley Continental Coupe.  Quiet.  Nicholas drives, begi humming, barely audible.  A Prince song, "Erotic City."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sings, to self)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...until the dawn... making love  till cherry's gone.. (humming, quiet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Erotic City, you and me... Nicholas changes lanes, HONKING the HORN, impassive.  We BARELY HEAR the BEEPING in here.  He glances back. He drives, adjusts his mirror.  Resumes humming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distinctive SAN FRANCISCO skyline on the horizon. Nicholas' building is a brownstone bookended by skyscrape Old money dwarfed by new.  The Bentley arrives...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bentley moves past a valet station.  One VALET follow The Bentley takes its place.  A brass plaque reads: "NICHOLAS VAN ORTON, Van Orton Enterprises."  The valet o the car door for Nicholas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two objects on Nicholas' desk: phone and laptop computer. He's on the phone, operating the laptop with one hand. Business talk, mile-a-minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... might be perched up on majority  shares, but you're not the only one  who gets hurt if the actuals crash.   Forecasts were fucked to begin with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment Baer/Grant's P and L report  is placed in my hand, I will be speed  dialing your number. Empty walls.  No distractions.  MARIA, the proper executi assistant, stands practically at attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a promise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... I'm unfamiliar with the  term.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if Alan calls me with a sob  story about substantiation procedure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take evasive action: have your  secretary say you're in a meeting.   Goodbye, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Nicholas hangs up, shuffling computer windows: stock quot pie-charts, graphs, lists.  Maria refers to an index card

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Invitations: the Museum Gala.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fitzwilliam Botanical Garden  Annual Fundraiser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hinchberger wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me think... (sits back, eyes closed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hordes of men in tuxedos.  Everyone's  droning.  Ludwell's trying to break  the ice by reciting an off-color  limerick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatient)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll send your regrets.  Honestly,  why must I even bother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because, if you don't know about  society, you don't have the  satisfaction of avoiding it. A KNOCK and a female ASSISTANT enters.  There's a lot mor NOISE and ACTIVITY behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth on line three. Nicholas taps his fingers on his lips, considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your ex-wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who she is. (to assistant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... Happy Birthday, sir. Nicholas squints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (icily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Maggie. The assistant backs out.  Nicholas returns to his compute

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't mention the following,  except he was very insistent.  It's  obviously some sort of prank...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gentleman left a message requesting  a lunch, but I assured him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What gentleman, Maria?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Mister... Seymour Butts. Nicholas looks up.  He sits back, lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Under the Bleachers"... by Seymour  Butts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me?  I'm afraid I don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cancel lunch.  Make reservations at  Campton Place for me and Mr. Butts. Maria nods, heading out, high heels clicking as she cross

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, put the reservation in my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upscale.  Quiet.  Nicholas is in a booth facing the rear, studying a thick FINANCIAL STATEMENT, making tiny notatio A WAITRESS arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to order, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still waiting... Nicholas points out the other plate.  The waitress leaves

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me... She returns.  He slides his empty glass toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was iced tea. He's returned to his report.  The waitress takes the glas and leaves, irritated.  Nicholas checks his watch.  An  EXAGGERATED SNEEZE is HEARD and liquid hits the back of h neck -- AH-CHOO!... Nicholas jumps, sickened, turning to face CONRAD, who hol a spray bottle and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there, Nickie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (repulsed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad, what a surprise.  Gesundheit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Seymour Butts."  I never get tired  of that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why it's a classic.  Come on,  man... how 'bout a hug... ? Nicholas is wiping his neck with a napkin as Conrad force hug on him.  Conrad takes a seat, good-looking, unkempt,  tan, wearing a too-big suit jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gave me a free jacket at the  door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be wanting it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not after I'm done with it. (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I've been here.  In grad- school I bought crystal-meth from  the maitre d'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which grad-school? Conrad smiles.  The brothers take each other in for a mom Long moment.  They're a bit stunned to be reunited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do you.  And to think I was  worried...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long's it been?  Since mom died...  four years?  How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divorced.  Remarried to some  pediatrician or gynecologist, or  pediatric gynecologist, in Sausalito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad, I liked her.  So, you're  all alone in the House of Pain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I redecorated.  What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nowhere in particular.  Don't you  keep track of my whereabouts anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie... what brings you here?  Is  everything alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need anything from you.  I  was laying on a beach somewhere in  Spain, naked, and, it hit me --  Nickie's birthday.  So, here I am,  four layovers, twenty-seven hours  flying and one donkey ride later.   Not necessarily in that order. Conrad drops an envelope on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have. Nicholas opens it, takes out a sappy, Hallmark B-day card A BUSINESS CARD falls out.  Nicholas picks it up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you get for the man who has  just slightly more than everything? The card: "Consumer Recreation Services."  With a PHONE N and ADDRESS below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call that number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Consumer Recreation Services." What,  do they make golf clubs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me.  Call that number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They make your life fun.  Their only  guarantee is you will not be bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've heard of it.  You've seen  other people having it.  They're an  entertainment service, but more than  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't an escort service?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a profound life experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a stroke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call them.  Trust me.
The waitress shows up with Nicholas' iced tea, spills som Nicholas blots it up with a napkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  Let me get you another napkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be fine... if we could just... She moves off as Nicholas raises a finger to order, ignor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me you'll call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I would...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you still on medication?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you say that? The waitress arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to order, gentlemen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignores, to Conrad)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean it like it sounded...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not on anything anymore.  I'm  not even seeing a shrink.  I'm happy. (notices waitress,  turning to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind... ?! The waitress gives him a look, leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nicholas)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd like this.  Best  thing I ever did.  If you don't want  to do it, DON'T...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call them, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it for YOU.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay... okay? (pause, studies card)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just... you know I hate surprises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know... Conrad CLINKS his fork against a glass, motioning... Behind Nicholas, WAITERS, WAITRESSES and BUS-BOYS, lying wait, now come to SING "HAPPY BIRTHDAY." Conrad stands, loving it.  Nicholas forces a fake smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bentley cruises hilly streets, ESTATES on all sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas is on his CELLULAR PHONE.  CLASSICAL MUSIC PLAYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from cellular)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... seen the profitability report.   No one's happy with the numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cellular)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine how much MORE unhappy I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll deal with Alan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Nicholas.  Sleep well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I plan to. He increases VOLUME on the CLASSICAL MUSIC, makes a turn. He looks out his window, watching the street roll past...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK/GRAINY HOME MOVIES
dialogues.text: SILENT, HOME MOVIE-ISH IMAGES as before: YOUNG NICHOLAS, peers out from a LIMOUSINE, watching his neighborhood pas PERIOD FASHIONS, PERIOD CARS and HOUSES...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE, IN THE BENTLEY
dialogues.text: Nicholas faces front.  The Bentley comes to the formidabl FRONT GATE of the mansion.  The gate begins to slide open Nicholas stares ahead, expressionless.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK/GRAINY HOME MOVIES
dialogues.text: The LIMOUSINE pulls up the ungated driveway.  Young Nicho emerges, carrying books, waving goodbye to the CHAUFFEUR. Young Nicholas runs past rose bushes, heading to the hous but slows, looking up... High up, Nicholas' FATHER, in a robe, stands on a balcony railing, looking to the sky.  He's weary, lowers his gaze Young Nicholas is puzzled, gives a tentative wave. Father just stares, eyes dead, expression blank.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE, IN THE BENTLEY
dialogues.text: Nicholas looks down, puts the car in gear and drives... THRU THE WINDSHIELD: the Bentley's headlights sweep the  stately Van Orton house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas exits the garage, walks up the garden path.  Ahe Ilsa's leaving through the kitchen door of the house, hea across the yard to the GUEST HOUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner's in the oven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  Goodnight. At the rear door, Nicholas stops himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I saw Conrad today. Ilsa stops, looking back.  They're far from each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did?  How is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  I think he's into some sort  of new personal improvement cult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, at a loss)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... send my love, if you see him  again. Nicholas nods.  Ilsa leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas uses mitts to remove a dinner plate from the ove sets it on a waiting tray: huge cheeseburger and hand-cut french fries, perfectly presented. Nicholas picks up a CUPCAKE with a B-day candle in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nose-bleed-high ceilings.  Cavernous fireplace.  THREE TV in the ENTERTAINMENT WALL, the largest showing CNN. Nicholas is seated in a chair facing his meal, pouring a  glass of champagne. He toasts to no one, takes a sip.  The PHONE RINGS.
Nicholas looks to it, hesitates.  He hits SPEAKERPHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to speakerphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from speakerphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleven forty.  You almost didn't  make it this year. Nicholas uses a REMOTE to MUTE BERNARD SHAW on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have a great birthday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Rose Kennedy have a black dress?   You know my parties.  I went not  once, but twice through the spanking- machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can only imagine.  How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie asked me the same thing today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie, really?  I always liked him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just thought this... might be  difficult for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just another birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant because of your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  He was forty, wasn't  he?  Hadn't thought about it, to  tell you the truth, thanks for the  reminder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I call you... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I honestly don't know.  Listen, give  my best to Doctor Mel and Rachel....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has a little brother on the way.   We just did the ultrasound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kidding?  An official nuclear  family.  You must be pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are.  We couldn't be happier. Nicholas smiles thinly, bored, waiting for more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, so... thanks for calling.   I've got some work here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should let you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too, Nicholas.  I mean that, I  really do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um-hm.  Good luck.  Bye. He PUSHES OFF the PHONE in the middle of her "goodbye." uses the t.v. remote to give BERNARD SHAW back his VOICE. Nicholas eats, watching the news.  He takes out the busin card Conrad gave him, looks at it, puts it on the table. The card: "Consumer Recreation Services." Nicholas sits back, chewing.  He stares at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK/GRAINY HOME MOVIES
dialogues.text: SILENT IMAGES: Nicholas' FATHER stands on the high balcon as before.  He looks skyward one last time, then LAUNCHES INTO SPACE... falling in EXTREME SLOW MOTION...
A head-first dive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "DING," elevator doors open.  Nicholas and TWO EXECUTIVES are talking.  As PEOPLE get on, the two executives get of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're getting off here. Nicholas follows.  He and the executives huddle nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, we understand each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it work on paper, and you can  count on my full support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right-o.  We'll talk.  Soon. They shake.  The executives walk away.  Nicholas returns elevator, pushes the button, waiting.  He turns, noticing A massive WALL OF TRANSLUCENT GLASS marks the office of  "C.R.S."  Modern.  Activity beyond it. Nicholas finds this disconcerting.  He takes out his wall digging up the C.R.S. business card, studying it... looki again to the glass facade to double check. He looks at his Rolex.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE GLASS DOORS
dialogues.text: Nicholas enters.  A female RECEPTIONIST speaks into a  HEADSET/PHONE.  EMPLOYEES mill about.  UTILITY MEN sort  crawlspace wiring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to receptionist,  shows "C.R.S." card)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this Consumer Recreation  Services... ? The Receptionist takes the card.  In the b.g., JIM FEINGO pays a DELIVERY GUY for CHINESE FOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't feel this reflects  negatively upon yourself. (to Nicholas)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a moment. (back into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hope we haven't caused you any  inconvenience.  Thank you for  considering C.R.S. She studies the card, hangs up and motions to Feingold, a bald, amiable engineer-type who passes with his food bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Feingold... could you assist  this gentleman? Feingold spins on his heels, looking, walking over with h hand out.  Nicholas shakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim Feingold, V.P., E.D.A.   Engineering and Data Analysis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not quite sure how this works.   My brother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, here we go... Feingold takes the card the receptionist offers, examines it, turns it over: finds FOUR NUMBERS on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of the numbers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent.  Let's get started. Nicholas picks up his briefcase to follow Feingold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big operation.  Feingold leads past partitioned cubicles  that seem to go on forever.  C.R.S. WORKERS abound. TELEPHONE CO. WORKMEN operate on the phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about  about all the hullabaloo.   We're still moving.  Stick with me...  I've got an office around here  somewhere.
Feingold reaches open BOXES, begins collecting pages from each, loading up on all sorts of forms.  he holds out his leaking, greasy food bag to Nicholas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind holding this... ? Nicholas reluctantly takes it, keeping it at arms length.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feingold types at his computer.  Nicholas stands, looking through the pile of forms on a clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (TYPES in keyboard)

dialogues.speaker: V-A-N... O-R-T-O-N...
dialogues.text: (studies screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gift from Conrad Van Orton.   Interesting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is? Feingold picks up his Chinese food, eats using chop-stick The BOX features a grinning CARTOON PANDA mascot,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still studying screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother was a client with our  London branch.  We do a sort of  informal scoring.  His numbers were  outstanding. (holds up box)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you're not hungry at all...? Tung Hoy, best in Chinatown...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eating, mouth full)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to fill out those forms.   Application, psych-tests: M.M.P.I.   and T.A.T.  For the financial  questionnaire, don't answer anything  you don't feel like.  We'll run a  T.R.W.... Nicholas looks through the densely written forms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading FORM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I sometimes hurt small animals.   True or False?"  "I feel guilty when  I masturbate..." Nicholas looks up, skeptical.  Feingold shrugs, embarrass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't write the questions.  I just  review them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's all this for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want a sense of your overall  capabilities, limitations, turn-ons,  turn-offs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean, what is it FOR?  What  are you selling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... it's a game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tailored specifically to each  participant.  Think of it as a great  vacation, except you don't go to it,  it comes to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of vacation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's different every time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patience waning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humor me with specifics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We provide whatever's lacking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if nothing's lacking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I make two suggestions...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really expect me to participate  without knowing a single thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, admit to yourself that it  sounds intriguing.  Second, you don't  have to decide today.  Take the silly  tests, fill out the forms.  One day,  the game begins.  You either love it  or hate it.  Decide then.  We're  like an experimental Book-of-the- Month-Club; drop out at any time  with no further obligation. (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was my sales pitch. Nicholas thumbs thru the forms one last time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long will these take?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An hour for those... maybe another  for the physical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Physical?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cursory examination.  Turn-your-head- and-cough sort of thing.  You'll be  out of here in no time. Feingold takes out a ballpoint pen, clicks it and offers to Nicholas.  Nicholas takes it. On the pen, in tiny letters: the C.R.S. LOGO.

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS C.R.S. OFFICES
dialogues.text: Nicholas fills out an APPLICATION of endless questions. #2 pencil fills in circles on a long M.M.P.I. form. CLOSE ON: "I often feel someone is following me.  True/Fa "I hate vegetables.  True/False."  "Vegetables hate me.   True/False." WHITE ROOM.  A stone-faced PSYCHOLOGIST holds up CARDS.

Nicholas gives his unenthusiastic interpretation into a T RECORDER, checks his Rolex. One CARD shows a large ant in an apron feeding a TV dinne to a human child.  That card is replaced by another of a slipping head over heels on a banana peel. - Nicholas wears HEADPHONES, facing a TECHNICIAN, raising finger on his left fist or right fist for each low BEEP. Nicholas sighs, can't believe he's doing this.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUES
dialogues.text: Electronic MONITORS and PRINTERS record Nicholas' EEG and EKG.  He's on an exam table, wearing a paper gown, covere in SENSORS and WIRES, talking on a C.R.S. telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... cancel.  Push Cooper back to  Wednesday afternoon. A TECHNICIAN studies readouts.  A NURSE takes BLOOD PRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Sutherland called about  Baer/Grant Publishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow.  Hold on... (to NURSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much longer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard that two hours ago. The nurse smiles, pumping up the blood-pressure cuff. Nicholas returns to the phone. - DARK ROOM.  Images FLASH on a screen: SHAPES, CURSE WOR PICTURES of U.S. PRESIDENTS, INSECTS... In flickering light, Nicholas, still in his gown, watches with THREE BUTTONS before him, pushing one from time to t Frustrated, he looks around.  He stands and turns...
Directly into the projector's bright BEAM OF LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... ?  Anyone there? (squints, holds up  hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas dresses, alone, pulling up his pants.  He notice above: a MIRRORED DOME in the corner, obviously a camera. Nicholas pulls on his jacket as Feingold arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to keep you waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.  It's been terrific  spending the entire day with your  "crack team".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all down to this... Feingold holds out a CLIPBOARD with PAPERWORK in it. Nicholas takes it, studies it, wary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An insurance company requirement.   It states that you are aware "the  game" exists and that you are a  willing participant in said game, so  on and so forth. Nicholas flips a page and Feingold leans over, pointing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of the paperwork)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One guarantee.  Payment's entirely  at your brother's discretion and, as  a gift, dependent on your  satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, I don't like it, he doesn't  pay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's never happened.  We've never  had an unsatisfied customer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, dissatisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glances at form)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right -- you're a left-brain  word fetishist. Nicholas uses the C.R.S. pen to sign.  Feingold turns pag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Initials... initials, and... (another page)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sign here. Nicholas is about to sign when Feingold grabs his wrist..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In blood. (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just kidding. Nicholas signs.  Feingold tears out a few PINK TINTED COP and hands them to Nicholas, kind of in a hurry now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your copies, thank you.  Keep the  pen.  We'll let you know. Feingold exits, gives a thumbs-up and a WINK, shuts the d Nicholas is a bit bewildered.  He continues dressing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering to self)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... grown man just winked at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! -- a blue racquetball BALL SLAMS a wall... THRU A WINDOW: Nicholas plays, alone, swatting violently the ball.  We HEAR a PHONE CONVERSATION in VOICE OVER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Monday or Tuesday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately I'm working all evening.   Wednesday's the only possibility  right now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  I get to pick the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, I went to C.R.S...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  What'd you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They seemed disorganized. Nicholas finishes playing, exits.  The ball keeps bouncin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the office is new.  When I did  it in London, they'd been around  awhile.  You gonna do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't decided yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carpeted floors and mahogany lockers.  Nicholas sits at h locker, wet, in a monogrammed robe, toweling his hair. VOICES can be HEARD O.S.: BUSINESSMAN 1 and BUSINESSMAN 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... getting in on the ground floor  of the next Disneyland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.R.S. will not go public.  They're  family owned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stranger things have happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they haven't, actually. Nicholas leans to look around a locker.  Businessman 1 an dress, two fat-cats.  Nicholas leans back, still listenin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just opened here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The game in San Francisco?  You see,  they're doing fine without any of  us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas enters, looking around, spotting Businessman 1 a 2 across the room.  He gets the BARTENDER'S attention,  motioning to the businessmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New members?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe so, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This round's on me. Nicholas moves casually toward the men...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER.  Another round arrives at the table where Nicholas and Businessman 1 and 2 chat.  The businessmen smoke ciga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... last time I played Pebble, I  swore I'd never pick up a club again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of games... I couldn't help  but overhear you talking about C.R.S. Businessman 1 and 2 share a furtive glance.  Nicholas  discretely waves cigar smoke out of his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only mention it because I took the  test this afternoon, down on  Montgomery Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you?  Kudos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, yours hasn't started?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.  I was hoping you could  tell me... uh... (almost embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? Businessman 1 and 2 smile.  Shared enlightenment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Businessman 2,  knowingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eternal question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nicholas)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I envy you.  I wish I could go back  and do it for the first time all  over again... He raises his glass.  They toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's to... new experiences. (gulps drink)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'll excuse me, I've got to be  going.  'Night, Jon... Nicholas. He leaves.  Nicholas focuses on Businessman 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you play recently?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm?  No, about a year ago.  I was  working out of Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard good things about their  London branch. (leans in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to admit, it sounds like  some fantasy, role-playing nonsense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to know what it is?  What  it's all about? (off Nicholas' nod)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John.  Chapter nine.  Verse twenty- five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, uh... haven't been to Sunday school  in years...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Whereas once I was blind, now I can  see." (rises)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night, Nick.  Best of luck. Businessman 2 puffs his cigar, walks away.  Nicholas watc him go, then pauses, puzzled, mouthing the words to himse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A table of unhappy LAWYERS.  Nicholas goes thru a thick  CONTRACT with a red pen, CIRCLING, CROSSING-OUT and SCRAW QUESTION MARKS ON paragraphs that displease him. SUTHERLAND, trust personified, in his late 50's, stands b Nicholas, imperturbable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still scrawling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As far as I'm concerned... (reading, x-ing out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... if the Baer/Grant meeting does  not take place tomorrow, it might as  well never take place at all. Nicholas slides the contract to the center of the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Mr. Van Orton boards his plane  in the morrow, he will have every  contract, side agreement and addendum,  the complete closing package,  flawlessly revised. INSTANT UPROAR as the contract is grabbed up.  All the la talk at once, fearful, arguing, protesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they quiet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is why you're paid twice what  you deserve.  So you will miss another  opera you would've fallen asleep  during anyway... During this, Nicholas' CELLULAR PHONE is HEARD RINGING. Nicholas takes it out, irritated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meeting has been moved forward.   It affords you the opportunity to  show our client how well you will  rise to his exhilarating challenge. QUIET COMMOTION resumes as Nicholas takes his cellular ph to a corner, answering impatiently:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cellular)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from cellular)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas van Orton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Cynthia calling from C.R.S...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get this number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've finished processing your  application...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in a meeting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'm afraid your application was  rejected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't feel this reflects  negatively upon yourself.  We hope  we haven't caused you any  inconvenience...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is absurd...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for thinking of C.R.S. CLICK -- she's hung up.  Nicholas folds the phone and poc it, his mind suddenly far away from the meeting behind hi Sutherland steps close, concerned, quiet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything wrong... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  Nothing at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas guides the Bentley down streets lined with  skyscrapers, staring ahead.  A previous PHONE CONVERSATIO is HEARD in V.O., a PHONE RINGING... RINGING... RINGING..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like voice-mail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll connect you.  Thank you for  calling the Four Seasons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bentley heads towards home.  The V.O. PHONE CONVERSAT CONTINUES uninterrupted, CLICKING, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice-mail recording)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Conrad.  Leave a message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waits till after  BEEP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie, it's Nicholas.  Give me a  ring when you get a chance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bentley reaches the VAN ORTON GATES, which open slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About your birthday gift.  Things  are tight right now.  I'm just not  sure whether it'll fit my schedule.   Anyway, see you at dinner tomorrow. The PHONE is HEARD DISCONNECTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bentley's headlights sweep the front of the Van Orton house.  There's something there, on the ground...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BENTLEY
dialogues.text: Nicholas stops the car, peering ahead, worried... THRU THE WINDSHIELD: A BODY lies face down on the edge of the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK/GRAINY HOME MOVIES
dialogues.text: The BODY of Nicholas' FATHER, sprawled face-down, in near the same place, head twisted, mouth bloody.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Nicholas gets slowly out of the Bentley, reluctant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello!  What are you doing there? (no reaction)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful... Nicholas CLAPS his hands.  The body doesn't stir.  Nichol look all directions, then approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Nicholas nudges the body with his foot.  He crouches,  confused, turning the limp body.  It's a grotesque HARLEQ not unlike the clown from Nicholas' seventh birthday, wit shiny face of painted wood. Nicholas looks around for an explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door opens.  Nicholas enters with the Harlequin depositing it on a hallway BENCH. A half-inch of RED RIBBON sticks out from the Harlequin's lips.  Nicholas tugs the ribbon... pulling out a GOLD KEY tied to the other end. Three letters embossed on the key: "C.R.S."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas sits with his evening's meal, examining the key. CNN on TV.  He looks across the room to the couch where t Harlequin is slumped staring back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from television)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... according to Nicholas Van Orton,  millions of Americans will be affected  by this legislation. Nicholas hears this vaguely in the back of his mind, look to the TV.  BERNARD SHAW has moves on to the next story. Nicholas goes to the Harlequin, opening its hinged mouth, attempting to look inside.  He gets a knife from his tray uses it to probe the Harlequin's mouth, jabbing, prying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... number of criminals behind bars  growing by record numbers, with Van  Orton pointing the finger at stiff,  anti-crime regulations... Nicholas looks up.  He heard that.  He walks toward the T Bernard Shaw is reporting, nothing strange. Nicholas waits.  Nothing.  He walks away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... largest portion of population  incarcerated.  These figures were  given at a press conference called  today by Mr. Nicholas Van Orton. Nicholas turns, disbelieving.  Bernard Shaw apparently lo out FROM THE TELELVISION, perturbed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to spend the rest of the  evening prying at that clown's mouth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dumbfounded)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's frustrating for me if you don't  even pretend to pay attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your game, Nicholas, and  welcome to it.  I'm here to let you  in on a few ground rules... Bernard Shaw's FACE RIPPLES and GLITCHES occasionally,  revealing its true, computer-generated nature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've received the first key and  others will follow.  You never know  where you'll find them, or when or  how you'll need to use them, so keep  your eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waves his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you... ?  You can see me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you, I hear you.  Why don't we  save the questions till...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does this work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a tiny camera looking at you  right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.  Impossible.  You're  having a conversation with your  television. Nicholas touches the TV, feeling the seams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's miniaturized. Nicholas begins poking his butter knife between slots of television's speaker, stabbing, poking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how dangerous that is? Nicholas pries at the plastic speaker cover.  It's not ea but he's determined, cracking the plastic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Van Orton... ? The speaker cover breaks off with a SNAP! and Nicholas sp holding the broken piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... Ilsa, what is it? ON T.V., Bernard Shaw grabs up pages, resumes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and in other news, auto workers  vowed to remain on picket lines... Ilsa's in the doorway, wondering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've finished for the evening.  Will  you be needing anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you.  Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight then. She leaves.  Nicholas throws the piece of television away Bernard Shaw stops reading now that the coast is clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind who that was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're uncomfortable.  You want to  know how a camera got into your home,  don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do. ON TELEVISION: Bernard Shaw is REPLACED by a FISH-EYED IM of NICHOLAS' DEN.  It shows Nicholas from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: room, keeps his eye on the TV as a guide...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from t.v., o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... cold... cold... warmer...   warmer... ON TELEVISION: Nicholas gets bigger as he gets closer to. The Harlequin.  Nicholas leans, looks at the clown's eyes ON TELEVISION: Nicholas' face is huge, distorted. Nicholas pries one of the Harlequin's glass eyes with his knife, pulling it out and examining it. ON TELEVISION: The Harlequin's P.O.V. turns to STATIC. Bernard Shaw returns with a PHONE NUMBER SUPERIMPOSED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Write this number down.  It's a 24- hour Consumer Recreation Services  hotline, for emergencies only.  But,  don't call asking what the object of  the game is; figuring that out is  the object of the game. Nicholas feels his pockets, finds the C.R.S. pen.  He com up with a VALET PARKING TICKET to scrawl the number on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck and congratulations on  choosing C.R.S.  We now return you  to your regularly scheduled program... STATIC and SNOW, then CNN's Bernard Shaw is back for real newscasting.  Nicholas reads the number he wrote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas crouches at a coaxial CABLE LINE at the side of house.  He fingers a BOX with a miniature LOOP and RABBIT EAR ANTENNA that's been spliced into the line. He starts to unscrew it... then thinks twice.  He leaves

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas enters thru the back door.  He pauses, looking o at the night.  He closes the door and locks it.  He PUNCH the ALARM CODE into a KEYPAD. Nicholas takes his Bentley key chain from its hook, takes out the gold, "C.R.S." key... adding it to the keychain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas enters the vast, busy terminal, briefcase in han He walks with purpose, but is extra-aware of the world ar him.  He notices... A MAN and WOMAN engaged in a SIGN LANGUAGE conversation. A MAN reading a newspaper peers from behind the pages. A JANITOR opens a door with a big KEY CHAIN full of keys. A MAN on a payphone seems to be staring at Nicholas... Nicholas turns his head to keep an eye on the man, practi bumping into a grimy HOMELESS BUM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me out there?  Used to be an  affluent fella, till some folks did  this to me... Nicholas moves away, leaving the homeless man behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ignore me.  I got screwed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet MUSIC.  Rich people's lounge.  Nicholas sits with a cup of coffee, considering magazines on a coffee table. seats down, a BUSINESSMAN coughs and rises, leaving his  newspaper on the empty seat between Nicholas and himself.

Nicholas glances down, curious when he sees... A smiling-clown-face INFANT'S RATTLE on the seat beside,  sticking out from under the paper. Nicholas catches only a glimpse of the exiting businessma Nicholas looks around, picks up the rattle. He rattles it, studies it, rattles it in his ear.  He tri to see thru it by holding it up to the light.  He doesn't notice the MOTHER who enters with a baby, watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me... Nicholas looks up, realizes, awkward, offering the rattle She takes it and exits. There's a BESPECTACLED MAN watching Nicholas. Nicholas notices, tries to ignore. But, bespectacled man is really staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sits forward, fed up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I help you... ? Nicholas' tone has turned other heads.  Bespectacled man  seems embarrassed, shy, taps his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... ?  What is it? Bespectacled man taps his chest again, points at Nicholas Nicholas looks down.  Inside his suit jacket -- a huge bl INK STAIN across his shirt.  Nicholas stands, aghast, tak out the offending pen. It's the "C.R.S." pen, dripping ink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running water.  Nicholas tries to clean his shirt, blotti it ineffectually with wet paper towels.  he looks in the  mirror, crestfallen.  The stain's worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy... you still out there?
Nicholas looks around.  He's alone, except for a MAN in a TOILET STALL.  All we see are the man's brown shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from toilet stall)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in a little bit of trouble... The man's hairy hand motions from below the stall.  Nicho backs away, nervous, grabs his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need paper.  There's none in here.   Come on, help a guy out... Nicholas considers, then hurries to exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?!  Anybody?  Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas' briefcase rides into the x-ray machine. Nicholas drops his keys, cellular phone and Rolex in a tr He passes thru the metal detector.  A SECURITY GUARD brin the tray to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice watch. Nicholas smiles tolerantly, collects his belongings.  He  waits at the x-ray conveyor belt, which is stopped.  A FE GUARD studies the x-ray monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a problem? The female guard looks up, turns the conveyor belt back o Nicholas' briefcase arrives. Nicholas moves on, aggravated.  Ahead, Sutherland rises f a seat along the concourse hallway, walking to meet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't expecting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanted to wish you luck.  Not that  you'll need it. Sutherland offers the contract, points to Nicholas' shirt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attractive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (paging thru contract)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I checked it personally. Nicholas nods, props his briefcase up on a window ledge,  opens it and drops the contract in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas' jet touches down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas follows a CHAUFFEUR.  The chauffeur opens a LIMO door.  Several pressed SHIRTS hang waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the shadow of the Baer/Grant Publishing offices, the  limousine idles.  Downtown Seattle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet ALAN BAER, elderly CEO, blue-blooded, pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All these years... the first time  ever you step foot in these offices,  it's to ask me to step down? Nicholas stands by CHILDREN'S TEXT BOOK mock-ups.  "Math- Magic."  "Wonder-Words."  They're "Little Baer Books."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promised you'd meet projections,  Alan.  A dollar sixty per share you  said.  So, I don't think this is so  surprising a visit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Projections were far too optimistic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admittedly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our E.P.S. was one fifty last quarter.   We're up eight cents per share.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, the expectation was ten.  And,  in this case, expectation is  everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you really hold me to it over  pennies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My stock's falling.  Isn't yours?   Those pennies are costing me millions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stock will turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It probably will.  In fact, I'd go  so far as to say it almost certainly  will, in time.  Why should I settle  for that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's fair.  Give me next  quarter.  If you still feel this  way, vote your shares...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talking tomorrow.  Today is  what counts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You intractable son-of-a-bitch.  If  your father could see you now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father was a friend.  Goddamn  it... I watched you grow up.  How do  you end up treating me like this? This swings Nicholas into a new mode: acutely-focused ang

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is so very inappropriate for you  to mention my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or, did you think this, between us,  was friendship?  Just because you  went fishing with my father, I should  sit on my hands while you throw my  money away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be done in a minute.  You  misspoke before.  You're not "stepping  down."  I'm taking you out at the  knees.  The whole point is to prove  that you're not deciding anything  anymore.  I'm firing you.  Action's  taken.  Confidence restored.  Stock  goes up.  I sell my shares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no Baer/Grant Publishing  without Alan Baer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember Daniel Grant?  Do they say,  "without Daniel Grant, there is no  Baer/Grant Publishing?"  He's gone  sailing, Alan.  He's out there  enjoying his golden years, probably  wondering where you are. At Alan's desk, Nicholas clears a space for his briefcase

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made a promise.  You failed.   The severance I'm offering is more  than equitable.  Valid tonight only. (looks at watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For one hour. Nicholas takes a pen from a holder, lays it on the blotte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll step outside, so you'll have  the privacy you need to read and  sign it. He tries to unlatch his briefcase clasp.  It's stuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could fight you on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could.  But, if I leave without  your signature, this agreement begins  to disintegrate; benefits shrink,  options narrow, compensations shrivel. Nicholas works on the briefcase the whole time, distracti growing as it becomes a true struggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... it is in your best interest...   to sign presently. Nicholas sits, pulling the latch, trying to see what's ja It refuses to open.  Nicholas stares at it, frustrated,  then... an odd realization... He takes his keys out, finds the C.R.S. KEY, tries it... It doesn't fit.  It was never meant for this lock.  Alan  Baer watches, wondering. Forgetting himself, Nicholas grabs up the briefcase, pull grunting, desperate, striking it with his palm. Nicholas straightens, immediately composed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... as luck would have it, you've  just gotten a reprieve,  I'm sure  you'll come around to my way of  thinking. (picks up briefcase)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a plane to catch.  My attorneys  will contact you. Nicholas exits.  Alan Baer doesn't know quite what to thi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the sidewalk, Nicholas bashes his briefcase over and o again against a fire hydrant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas' jet touches down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas sits staring.  His battered briefcase is near. checks his watch, impatient, flags down a WAITER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a message up front from a  Conrad Van Orton? The waiter goes.  Nicholas drums his fingers.  He slides of the booth, rising. when a WAITRESS knocks into him wit tray.  Wine spills.  Glasses crash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, excuse me... Nicholas looks down at his wine-stained front.  The waitr is CHRISTINE, same waitress as the other night.  She trie to clean him up with a napkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, don't do that... Nicholas snatches the napkin from her, wiping his suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I apologize, sir, I'm having a bad  day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bad month.  You did the exact same  thing to me last week. Christine's taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't help me, just get more napkins.   And soda water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gets more napkins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrific.  I now have a hundred dollar  dry cleaning bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I was sorry... Nicholas turns his back on her, throwing wet napkins, pic up clean ones, still patting at the stain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stews)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole.
Nicholas turns, angry.  The MAITRE D' arrives, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christine!   Mister Van Orton is a  valued customer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, you kiss his ass. She's leaving, but the maitre d' pulls her aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't talk to me like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet, evenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I apologized, I offered to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clean out your locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, Dennis.  Soon as I get my money  for this week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right with you. Christine heads to the back.  The maitre d' motions for B BOYS to clean, smoothly guiding Nicholas to a new table..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm terribly sorry, Mr. Van Orton.   If you're not too uncomfortable,  will this table suit you for a  complimentary meal... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll fetch your waiter. Nicholas sits, keeps wiping his shirt as the maitre d' hu away.  After a moment, a uniformed WAITER moves past, lea a CHECK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check, sir. Nicholas picks up the check, indignant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me...

But, the waiter is long gone.  Nicholas shakes his head,  then the check catches his eye... "DON'T LET HER GET AWAY scrawled across it. Nicholas turns to look.  The waiter who brought the check crosses the room, goes out the front door. Nicholas rises, following...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas comes out the front, sees: the waiter has crosse the street, still moving... The waiter gets in a CAR as the car pulls quickly away. Nicholas is baffled, looks at the check, heads back insid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christine exits the kitchen door, purse over her shoulder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to doorway)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... ?  Well, fuck you and your  vichyssoise, prick. She heads down this dark alley.  After a moment, Nicholas follows, hurrying to catch up, briefcase in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me... Miss... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no... you. Christine picks up the pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure how this works.  Do you  have something for me... ?  I got  this note...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you babbling about, psycho?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know what's going on.  Are  you part of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?  I'm going on my  second job this month, and now I'm  going on unemployment.
She keeps walking.  Nicholas stops, ponders.  He follows. They're nearing the end of the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I need to explain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't explain.  Fuck off.  Goodbye. Nicholas steps in a deep, splattering pot-hole, stumbles, pants soaked, stopping, fed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch! Christine rounds the corner, heading down the street. Nicholas reaches the sidewalk, watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts after)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to... ask you... (giving up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm apologizing... He heads back the way he came.  A strangled CRY is HEARD. Nearby, a HEAVY MAN falls to his knees, then falls face  forward to the concrete.  Nicholas looks around, alone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Heavy Man)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are... are you okay?! DOWN THE SIDEWALK, Christine slows, looks back... Nicholas bends, trying to see the man's face, seems afrai to actually touch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... this can't be... Nicholas looks up to see Christine running back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... he fell. Christine kneels, turns Heavy Man on his side and feels f a pulse.  Heavy Man convulses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he's breathing. Christine clears Heavy Man's airway, pulling saliva and m from his mouth with two fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't just stand there, get help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking out his  CELLULAR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't be real...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's pissing his pants.  Is that  real enough for you?  Call 911!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright... okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's turning blue! Nicholas is starting to believe, dialing, circling as  Christine gives C.P.R.  He listens to his phone -- STATIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn... He backpedals in the street, cellular to his ear, trying catch a signal, tilts his head.  STATIC.  A HORN BLARES - CAR barely misses Nicholas, DRIVER cursing. Nicholas anxiously punches buttons.  He spots a SQUAD CAR and runs toward it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police! SAME STREET -- TIME CUT... SIREN BLASTING, an AMBULANCE is parked.  PARAMEDICS pull stretcher, helped by TWO COPS, hurrying to the prone Heav Man.  A crowd is gathered. Nicholas and Christine watch the paramedics work.  COP ON hands Nicholas a clipboard, everything hurried, overlappe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to fill these out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know this man. Christine takes the clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to cop, of clipboard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need... ? Paramedics hoist heavy Man on a stretcher and take him to the ambulance.  Cop Two goes to help them lift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Christine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get involved in this. Christine moves to climb into the ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nicholas)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to detain you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Report's got to be filled out.  Ride  with your wife.  We'll meet at the  hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting to cop)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're moving! Cop One leads Nicholas to the ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a few blocks.  Help me out,  huh, pal? Nicholas reluctantly gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busy streets.  The ambulance rockets on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIREN WAILING.  Paramedic works.  Christine fills out for Nicholas tries to see where they're going, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (digging in his pocket)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten minutes ago, I'm looking forward  to a quiet dinner.  I get a note... Nicholas slaps his CHECK on top of Christine's paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly I'm in an ambulance.  Why  am I in an ambulance?! He looks out the window.  Christine studies the check: "DON'T LET HER GET AWAY," finds it odd, looks to Nicholas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wincing, to paramedic  of Heavy Man)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's breathing, isn't he?  Is the  siren entirely necessary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Emergency Vehicles Only."  The ambulance races down a RA moving across this big underground garage, doing a u-turn Backs up toward a busy EMERGENCY ROOM ENTRANCE.  MEDICAL  PERSONNEL everywhere.  Other ambulances.  INJURED PEOPLE. Our paramedics get out and unload Heavy Man. Nicholas and Christine get out, disoriented.  Heavy Man's rushed inside via automatic doors.  Christine hands off t clipboard to Nicholas, following the stretcher...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's talk to whoever can get this  over with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading clipboard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on... (of the clipboard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want your driver's license  number.
Christine returns to look, and suddenly ALL THE LIGHTS GO OUT.  Nicholas and Christine look up.  In the surrounding darkness, we HEAR EVERYONE FLEEING... FOOTSTEPS SCATTER... then, SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to be kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... is... happening... ? The only light is a BULB inside the ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgust)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to tell you... it's a  game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tosses clipboard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's run by a company... they play  elaborate pranks.  Things like this.   I'm really only now finding out  myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights went out, one hundred  people all ran away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, the guy who turned blue  and wet himself... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, about this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be. Christine climbs into the ambulance, searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's got to be a flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand why they're getting  you involved. IN THE AMBULANCE, she finds all drawers and cabinets EMPT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so fucked.  You don't fuck  with people like this.  I thought  that guy was gonna die.  I gave him  mouth to mouth! She digs in her purse, finds a book of restaurant MATCHES She lights a match, climbing out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know that's the way? She just keeps walking. A distant "DING" is HEARD.  Far away, an ELEVATOR OPENS w a light inside.  Christine stops. Christine changes direction, heading for the elevator. Nicholas hurries to follow.  The match burns out.  A mome then Christine strikes another, lighting the way, barely. As they squeeze between parked cars, Christine searches..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you all go?  Motherfucking  frat boys.  You better hide. (to Nicholas)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your life so pathetic that this  is something you're willing to pay  for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a gift... from my brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How thoughtful.  The gift of  inconvenience. NIcholas stumbles.  A beer BOTTLE is HEAR SKITTERING away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the elevator.  Nicholas pushes a button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ground floor. He and Christine step back and wait, looking up.  And wai and wait, looking unhappily to each other. Nicholas pushes all the buttons.  Nothing happens. Christine opens the EMERGENCY PHONE door: NO PHONE. Nicholas touches his finger to a KEY HOLE below the butto He takes out keys, finds the C.R.S. KEY, tries it...  it  fits.  He turns it.  DOORS CLOSE and the ELEVATOR MOVES. Nicholas is pleased, sees Christine wondering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of the key)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long story. (off her stare)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found this key in the mouth of a  wooden Harlequin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind. The ELEVATOR LURCHES, DROPS, then HALTS.  LIGHTS OUT, rep by RED EMERGENCY LIGHT.  A MOTOR is HEARD DYING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like that. (pushing buttons)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're stuck. Nicholas takes out his phone, puts it to his ear.  STATIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pockets phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No signal. Christine pounds on the buttons and doors, frustrated.  S tries to pry the doors open.  Can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the going rate for the "trapped- in-elevator-adventure" these days? Nicholas hits BUTTONS hard.  Christine studies the ceilin moving under the square seam of the TRAP DOOR, pointing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read what it says: "Warning, do not  attempt to open.  If elevator stops,  use emergency... "

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there was one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... wait for help."  Wait for help.   I'm not opening a door that  specifically warns me not to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you suggesting we wait till  someone finds us? Nicholas considers this, looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trap door CREAKS open.  Nicholas looks up from the  elevator, standing on hand rails.  He gets down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you a boost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't an attempt to be gallant.   If I don't lift you, how are you  going to get there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You pull me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's much easier this way.  Come on,  step up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not wearing underwear.  Okay?   There, I said it.  Satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at her skirt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  FIne. Nicholas starts climbing...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ELEVATOR SHAFT
dialogues.text: Nicholas comes up, batting cobwebs, tentative.  He grips handful of grease, disgusted.  He climbs thru, catching h jacket on a jutting screw, FABRIC RIPPPPPPPPING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops. Nicholas stands in the shaft, pissed.  He looks for a pla to wipe his hand, wipes it on his jacket, looking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a ladder here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My hero.  Let's go. Nicholas offers his grease covered hand from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. Nicholas withdraws that hand, offers the clean one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elevator doors shift, forced from inside.  Nicholas climb out, then pulls Christine out behind him.  They're head-t toe filthy, clothing ruined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.  My briefcase. He looks back down the shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resigned sigh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not like anyone could actually  open it. They walk, looking at the vast lobby and sky-lit ATRIUM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is C.R.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's C.R.S.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consumer Recreation Services.  It's  their building.  They... A BEEP is HEARD.  Nicholas looks above... Sees a MOTION SENSOR with a green light blinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... An ALARM SOUNDS; a loud RINGING BELL.  Nicholas backs awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't panic.  When security gets  here, we simply explain what  happened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll love that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... well... FOOTFALLS.  Nicholas turns to see Christine running away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over her shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explain for both of us! Nicholas looks around, unsure.  He follows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christine bursts thru "EMERGENCY EXIT" doors.  Nicholas  arrives.  He grips her arm and they walk, out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk, slowly.  Don't draw attention. Out for a stroll... TIRES SCREECH.  A SPOTLIGHT HITS them from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You!  Stay where you are! It's a SECURITY CAR on the other side of a fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run! They run, down the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIRENS HEARD.  Christine and Nicholas sprint round a corn all out... thru puddles, glancing back.  Ahead, a SECURIT CAR skids, starting for them.  Christine and Nicholas dou back.  She takes the lead. Christine spots something, makes a choice, moving into a  very NARROW ALLEY space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
