dialogues.text: Where are you going? (looks in, worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't fit there. She's making fine progress regardless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't! Nicholas sees the SECURITY CAR bearing down.  He must tur sideways to fit in the narrow alley, shuffling after. BEHIND, the car stops and SECURITY GUARD gets out, club i hand.  In the car, a GERMAN SHEPHERD barks. Security Guard tries to fit down the space, but can't.  H belly's too big, his utility belt catching.  He runs back the car, opens the door...
The German Shepherd shoots down the alley, a projectile..

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE TIGHT ALLEYWAY
dialogues.text: Christine comes out into OPEN AREA, running on, looking u Ruined buildings on all sides, CHAIN LINK FENCES everywhe Nicholas arrives, pissed, trying to catch up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You deserted me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a grown man.  I'm not  responsible for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one who started running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?  You're the one who... ! (sees something)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Christine runs faster.  Nicholas looks back... The German Shepherd's on its way... Nicholas faces front, runs, arms pumping, terrified... The German Shepherd's closing, growling... Christine and Nicholas reach the CHAIN LINK FENCE ahead..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Climb! Christine makes the leap first, scrambling up the fence. Nicholas climbs beside her, pulling himself up... The German Shepherd leaps... bites Nicholas' leg... Nicholas YELLS -- PANTS RIPPING.  The dog falls with a  mouthful of cloth. Christine and Nicholas reach the top of the fence, clingi balanced on their elbows, looking back.  The German Sheph barks and leaps. Christine and Nicholas start over the fence, beginning th climb down the other side...

ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE: three OTHER DOGS run from the shado Pit-Bulls and a Doberman, jumping and biting... Nicholas and Christine scramble back to the top. All the dogs hop up and down, snapping.  They gnash at ea other and bark at each other, frenzied. Nicholas and Christine have no choice but to hang, strand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what? Nicholas looks up, daunted.  He spots something... There's a place where the fence runs under a FIRE ESCAPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow me... Nicholas gets a toe-hold, shifts his elbows, grunting,  beginning the herky lateral climb toward the fire escape. Christine follows his example. Slow going.  DOGS BARKING NON-STOP, nipping at their heel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, you stupid, fucking dogs!! BARKING AND BARKING AND BARKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they guarding around here?   Each other? Nicholas slips, keeps grip, but loses a SHOE... The dogs catch the shoe in their jaws, fighting for it. Nicholas watches the shoe get torn to pieces, keeps movin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There goes a thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your shoes cost a thousand dollars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... two hundred dollars a toe.

Nicholas reaches the fire escape, balancing precariously reach it.  He climbs gracelessly up... He helps Christine after him, bringing her on board.  The lean against the rail, exhausted.  Nicholas looks to the  multi-leveled ladders above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess.  Me first? He climbs.  Christine looks down at the dogs, stupefied,  looks up at Nicholas on the CREAKING rusty fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is getting out of hand. As she starts up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABANDONED BUILDING.  Boarded-over windows are kicked open from inside.  Nicholas and Christine look out. They climb out onto ANOTHER FIRE ESCAPE, two stories up a a trash filled, dumpster crowded alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never did catch your name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas.  Nicholas Van Orton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas Van Orton?  What are you, a  czar? Nicholas moves to the catch of the fire escape ladder, un it.  The LADDER DROPS to bridge the gap to the ground, KE GOING, sliding free and disconnecting -- falls flat to th ground below with a LOUD, ECHOING CLATTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's classic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring down, misery)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why... ? Christine crosses to the far edge of the railing, points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hang down here and drop.  The  garbage'll break our fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think not. Christine climbs over the fire escape railing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afraid you're going to ruin your one- legged suit? She lowers herself down, hanging off, legs dangling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful... A metal DOOR is THROWN OPEN below.  TWO THAI BUS-BOYS com out, dumping garbage, smoking cigarettes, laughing. Above, Christine looks up at Nicholas, mortified.  She no urgently for him to help her back up.  Nicholas climbs th rail, beside her, trying to get a grip, none too effectiv Below, one bus-boy looks up, shouting.  The other bus-boy looks.  They back away, SPEAKING RAPID THAI, pointing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they... ? (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Christine lets go with one hand, trying to pull her skirt shut.  Nicholas loses hold, drops her... Christine lands hard in garbage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay... ?! Nicholas drops, alarmed... lands in broken plastic bags o wet garbage, slipping as he moves to Christine.  Bus-boys are helping her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay... I'm okay, thank you... Bus-boys keep questioning in Thai.  Nicholas and Christin brush off.  Nicholas takes off his spewed jacket, shakes in disgust, straightens his tie.  They stop... At the doorway, all the COOKS, BUS-BOYS, WAITERS and DISH WASHERS stare at Nicholas and Christine in wonder.
Nicholas and Christine stare back.  Nicholas looks to  Christine, brushing rotten lettuce off her shoulder, nods the restaurant workers, clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Table for two, please. He offers his arm to Christine, she takes it, they head i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONE CONTINUOUS LONG SHOT:  Nicholas and Christine walk, t their time, eating out of take-out boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points at skyline)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That tall, bright building.  Near  there. They walk a long time in silence.  A POLICE CAR moves fro behind.  POLICEMAN shines a flashlight up and down Nichol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything okay, miss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  How are you? The police car keeps pace, then drives on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas enters, turning on lights, which dim to a warm g Christine takes in the impressive office.  Nicholas cross to a wall, opens a hidden closet, chooses a shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a shower, if you'd like. Christine leans to peek in the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shower in your office?  You an  athlete or something? Nicholas puts on a new shirt.
Christine circles the desk, runs her fingers down his pho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Investment banking.  Moving money  from place to place. Christine has wandered to the closed blinds, opening them reveal a breathtaking view of the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm? (looks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. Nicholas takes out a SWEATSHIRT and offers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fresh shirt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes shirt, crossing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this was my office, I wouldn't  keep that closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't spend much time looking out  the window. (goes to desk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you a taxi. Christine faces away, throws off her filthy shirt... Nicholas, on the phone, looks to Christine's shapely back and RED BRA.  He averts his eyes, embarrassed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!  Uh... Christine puts on the PENN STATE sweatshirt, straightens

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Nicholas nods, phone to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO CABS.  Nicholas opens the door of the first for Chris She faces him, close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the owner of Campton Place.   I could talk to him in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.  It was a shitty job anyway.   I overreacted. Christine sits, keeps her legs out the door of the cab. Nicholas stands waiting for her to pull her legs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I've ever spent this  much time with someone who didn't  even ask my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The maitre d' called you Christine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (remembering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  Call me Christy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Christy.  It was nice  meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me an address so I can send  your shirt back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it. She looks up at Nicholas, sits inside.  He shuts the door and steps back.  Christine rolls her window down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a confession to make.  Someone  gave me six-hundred dollars to spill  drinks on you, as a practical joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously?  What did they say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said five hundred.  I said six.   They said the man in the gray flannel  suit.  I think I said, you mean the  attractive guy in the gray flannel  suit? Christine smiles, rolls up the window.  The taxi leaves. Nicholas watches it go.  A twinge of regret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas' cab pulls up at the closed restaurant, behind t Bentley.  A restaurant VALET sweeps the sidewalk, waves t greet as Nicholas gets out of the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas comes from the bathroom, just showered.  He look at CNN on TV.  He walks to change channels: infomercials, B+W movies, cartoons.  BUGS BUNNY.  Nicholas leaves Bugs  Bunny on, steps back, watching. He sits on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas sleeps.  Cordless PHONE RINGING.  He stirs, awak face creased, hair mussed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in phone, voice cracks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hel... hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Van Orton, it's Maria.  I... I  wasn't sure I should call...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it? Nicholas studies his CLOCK RADIO: 11:05.  He picks it up examines it, suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleven o'clock.  I took the liberty  of rescheduling your nine a.m. with  Allison and Dietrich.  Are you...  not not feeling well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be in in an hour.  I left my  briefcase at fifteen-thirty-three  Montgomery.  Check with their lost  and found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan Baer's in town, at the Ritz- Carlton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's requesting dinner tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll let him know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also, the Claremont Hotel called to  say they have your American Express  card at the front desk.  You left it  last night? Nicholas is confused.  He crosses with the phone, finds a studies his wallet.  He fingers an empty plastic pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I send someone... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Give me their number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight, four, three, three-thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See  you in awhile.  Goodbye. Nicholas hangs up, dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claremont Resort and Spa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Nicholas Van Orton.  I'm  told my American Express card...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mister Van Orton.  Everything's  in order.  The concierge has arranged  for the wine and flowers in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, a young woman phoned just now  to say she's on route but running a  little late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did this young woman leave her name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Nichola hangs up, interest piqued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas drives the Bentley.  PREVIOUS CONVERSATION:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no answer.  Would you like  his voice mail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him his brother called, and to  call back soon as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. CELLULAR DISCONNECT.  Nicholas looks in his rearview mirr THRU MIRROR: a grimy BLACK SEDAN follows... keeps distanc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grand hotel.  Nicholas leaves his car with the valet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the GLASS DOORS, Nicholas pushes thru.  A THIN MAN in plain suit isn't looking, BUMPS Nicholas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  My fault. Thin Man exits.  Nicholas crosses the opulent lobby to th desk.  The grinning HOTEL MANAGER spots him coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Mr. Van Orton.  Here you go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have we met? He hands over Nicholas' AMEX CARD, which Nicholas studies

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe so.  If you would just  sign here... The manager offers a CHARGE SLIP and pen.  Nicholas looks the manager, the slip, then signs.  The manager hits a BE A BELLHOP arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show Mr. Van Orton to his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The key?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a room key?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't I give you two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you didn't... Nicholas shakes his head and pats his pockets, stops, fee one pocket... reaches in and takes out a GOLD KEY on a ho key chain.  Nicholas looks to the GLASS DOORS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long hallway.  Nicholas follows the Bellhop.  They arrive the door to ROOM 277.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take it from here. He tips the Bellhop, who leaves, uses the key, entering..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas shuts the door.  There's a room-service cart wit wine chilling.  Nicholas moves down this short hall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... ? His jaw drops.  The room is TRASHED.  Curtains shredded,  furniture overturned, television imploded, mirror spiderw smashed, walls full of holes. Nicholas moves forward, having spotted... His battered BRIEFCASE on the ruined mattress. The latch is undone.  Nicholas opens it. Inside: MANY PHOTOGRAPHS of blurry SEX acts.  Bodies in  motion.  Limbs.  Breasts.  A NAKED WOMAN tied to the bed. One PHOTO shows two women entwined with a NAKED MAN who a to be NICHOLAS.  It's a so-so cut-and-paste job. A LOUD KNOCKING at the door startles Nicholas.  He closes the briefcase, freaked. He hurries to the door as POUNDING is HEARD again, puts h eye to the peephole. THRU THE PEEPHOLE: a MAID gets out her keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thru door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to make up the room. Nicholas fumbles with the SECURITY CHAIN, slides it in pl as the door opens -- stopped.  Nicholas keeps hidden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you come back later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.  Sorry. THRU THE PEEPHOLE: the maid moves away. Nicholas crosses to retrieve his briefcase, and is crossi back when he stops in his tracks upon seeing... On a dresser, a MIRROR covered in COCAINE lines and resid

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Nicholas turns on the faucet, washing the cocaine down th sink, hands shaking.  The mirror edge cuts his thumb and gives a cry, drops the mirror, which SHATTERS on the floo Nicholas sucks his thumb, puts it under the faucet.  He f a hand cloth and wraps it round his thumb. There are big blood droplets on the sink and floor. Nicholas grabs wads of tissues from a box on the back of toilet, using them to blot up the blood, throwing tissues the toilet and flushing. Nicholas keeps wiping blood.  The toilet burps, OVERFLOWI WATER SPILLS OUT... Nicholas backs away, panicked, exiting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas looks out from Room 277.  He sees a MAID CART, H an O.S. VACUUM CLEANER.  He run-walks down the hall, hugg his briefcase.  He pushes thru a STAIRWELL DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas takes his Bentley back from the valet, pulling o fast to the street.  Further back, the grimy BLACK SEDAN  moves from the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas' mind races.  He wipes sweat off his face. He glances in his rearview... THRU MIRROR: the black sedan, following again. Resolve comes to Nicholas, and anger.  He speeds up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bentley weaves thru traffic, taking a corner sharp. Nicholas spins the wheel, heading...

dialogues.speaker: DOWN AN ALLEYWAY
dialogues.text: Nicholas brakes hard, gets out of the Bentley and heads f the mouth of the alley... As the black sedan follows, blocked, stopping.  Nicholas  comes to pull open the car door, confronting the rumpled, PLUMP GUY behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck... ?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you following me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking  about.  I'm just driving... He falters as he follows Nicholas' angry gaze to the seat beside him where a FILE is open to a PHOTO of NICHOLAS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fumbling to close  file)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look... what I'm doing is none of  your business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Alan Baer "the Game?"  Is that  what this is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defiant pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friend... why don't you back off. He leans as he talks... inside his jacket, he wears a gun Nicholas reaches across and pulls the gun, hefting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of the gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice touch.  Does the game use real  bullets... ?

Nicholas points the gun at the sedan's rear tire, FIRES! The gun is SHOCKINGLY LOUS -- BURSTS the TIRE! Nicholas looks to the smoking weapon, blanching. Plump Guy leaps to the other seat, scrambling out the  passenger door, submissive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm a private investigator.   Somebody hired me to keep tabs on  you... Nicholas lifts the gun, unsure, pointing it awkwardly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who... who hired you? Plump Guy bolts, running away down the alleyway.  Nichola aims the gun after him, but catches himself, lowers it. runs the other direction, back to the Bentley... Nicholas gets in the car, drops the gun on the seat, driv

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BENTLEY
dialogues.text: Nicholas returns to the street, glancing back.  He looks the gun.  He opens the glove compartment, throws the gun He takes out his CELLULAR PHONE, dialing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from cellular)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Van Orton's office...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cellular)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria.  Have Sutherland meet me at  the Ritz-Carlton.  I'm on my way  there now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I tell him... ? But, Nicholas is already pushing DISCONNECT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas enters with briefcase.  Sutherland rises to foll

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HOTEL EMPLOYEE rolls a room service cart out.  Nicholas pushes past with Sutherland in tow.  Alan Baer, his hands WIFE and lovely DAUGHTER are seated at a table where a WA lays out a splendid meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas... this is unexpected. Nicholas takes out the SEX PHOTOS, throws them on the tab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you actually believe that because  you publish children's books, anyone's  going to care about my reputation? Wife and daughter are frightened.  Alan Baer covers the p with his napkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could print pictures of me wearing  nipple rings and butt-fucking Captain  Kangaroo... all anyone would wonder  was whether the stock was up, or  down. Sutherland's nervousness grows by the second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright, dear.  Mr. Van Orton...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still to Alan Baer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you've involved Conrad... is  unforgivable.  I am now your enemy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you finished?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  This is my lawyer, Samuel  Sutherland.  I thought you two should  meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We met, this morning.  I signed the  termination contract for Baer/Grace.   I accepted your settlement, Nicholas.   you were right.  I'm going sailing. Nicholas opens his mouth, but no words come.  He looks to Sutherland.  Sutherland nods to confirm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome to join our luncheon.   Maybe we can straighten this out. (motioning to...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife, Mary Carol, and my daughter- in-law, Kaliegh. Wife and daughter give mumbled greetings, having no desir to meet Nicholas.  Nicholas just stands stymied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems I've...  please, disregard  my apparently misguided remarks. Nicholas heads for the door, hurrying out.  Alan, wife,  daughter, the waiter and Sutherland exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... Sutherland walks to retrieve the sex photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy your lunch. Sutherland smiles, exiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas sits at his desk, opens his briefcase, checking contents.  Soon, Sutherland arrives, shutting the door. watches Nicholas, deciding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How concerned should I be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a misunderstanding.
Sutherland puts the SEX PHOTOS on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's playing hardball.  It's  complicated.  Can I ask a favor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find out about a company called C.R.S.   Consumer Recreation Services.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like they make tennis rackets.   What do we know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what I told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing else? Nicholas remembers.  He opens up a file drawer in his des

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gave me their waiver.  On  their... wait... Nicholas hands over a file, returning to his briefcase. finds an ENVELOPE with a SMILELY-FACE on it.  He opens it He takes out a silver-plated METAL CRANK.  Like a handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? Nicholas looks up.  Sutherland's looking in the file,  quizzically, hands it back... Nicholas studies PINK-TINTED PAGES; the pages Feingold ga him, once dense with words, now completely blank except f NICHOLAS' SIGNATURE and INITIALS several places.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of the pages)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ... I can't believe it...   invisible ink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're joking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what they do.  It's like...   being toyed with by a bunch of... (picks up SEX PHOTOS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depraved children. Nicholas examines each photo.  Sutherland goes to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well.  If you tell me not to  worry, I shan't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam... (as Sutherland stops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Sutherland exits.  Nicholas keeps examining the pictures. He sits forward, finding something... IN A PHOTO: the out-of-focus back of a NAKED WOMAN wearin only a RED BRA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (INTO PHONE-INTERCOM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria.  The other night... last night,  there was a woman here named  Christine.  I called a taxi, from  that company we use...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (FROM PHONE-INTERCOM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elite Taxi Company?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look into it.  Find out which car  answered and where they took her. Nicholas sits back.  He picks up the METAL CRANK, twists in his hands, frowning, pockets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rapid SOUND of a PHONE OFF THE HOOK is HEARD OVER: BE BEEP BEEP BEEP... The Bentley pulls in.  Headlights out.
IN THE CAR, Nicholas takes the gun from the glove compart and puts it in his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark.  The PHONE OFF THE HOOK is LOUDER, grating: BEEP BE BEEP BEEP BEEP...  Nicholas comes in the back door, peeri into the weak moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ilsa? Nicholas replaces the phone on its cradle.  QUIET. He reaches for a light switch, ZAP! -- BLUE SPARKS leap t his fingers.  Nicholas YELPS and shakes his hand out. The switch has been RIPPED OUT, leaving exposed wiring. Nicholas goes to his briefcase, getting the gun and movin forward, wary, calling out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ilsa!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the blackness, Nicholas comes to stand at the doorway, levels the gun at someone across the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a gun! There's a roaring fire in the giant fireplace and a FIGUR in a chair.  Nicholas eases forward... It's the HARLEQUIN in the chair, with a GLOSSY B+W PHOTO  between its teeth.  Nicholas pulls out the picture... A POLICE PHOTO of NICHOLAS' FATHER, his body sprawled. It's stamped "PROPERTY SFPD" in red. There's a NOTE paper-clipped behind: "Like my father before me, I choose eternal sleep."  At t bottom, a RED SIGNATURE ARROW affixed, "Please Sign Here. Suddenly, ALL LIGHTS SURGE TO LIFE, icy and ghoulish -- e and every bulb replaced by BLACK LIGHT... Nicholas pivots slowly, taking in the horror... The wrecked den is covered in FLUORESCENT SPRAY-PAINT

dialogues.speaker: COCKSUCKER" "SUCK IT" "C.R.S. RULES" "HAVING FUN, RICH
dialogues.text: BOY?"  Everywhere.  Across windows, paintings and curtain The ceiling is covered in "MOMMA'S BOY" and OBSCENITIES. Scaffolding's been left behind.  Used SPRAY CANS on the  splattered Oriental rug.  A PAINT/AIR COMPRESSOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... fuckers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glowing ANARCHY SYMBOL sprayed across the door which is throw open by Nicholas as he enters. It's all BLACK LIT here too.  GRAFFITIED and DESTROYED. "HELTER SKELTER: in jolting letters.  Nicholas backs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW: Nicholas down the hall and around corners, BLACK  LIGHTS above, walls covered in CURSES and MULTI-COLORED  SQUIGGLES.  Like a bad trip thru the Bat-Cave...

dialogues.speaker: DOWN STAIRS
dialogues.text: Past OTHER ROOMS likewise awash in vibrant slurs...

dialogues.speaker: THRU THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Now also revealed as ruined.  Nicholas goes out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas runs to the GUEST HOUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANGING on the FRONT DOOR.  Ilsa comes to look thru the  peephole, opens the door to a breathless Nicholas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Van Orton... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ilsa... you're alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. What do you mean?  What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did the alarm go off?  The house...   they... you didn't see... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking  about.  What's happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's been a break in.  Lock this  door and stay here.  Don't move a  muscle. Nicholas runs back toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crossing the lawn, Nicholas pulls out his cellular phone, dialing as he runs, takes out his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from cellular)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine-one-one, emergency...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cellular)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need the police.  There's been a  break-in at my home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from cellular)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, sir.  Stay on the line and  give me your address...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas enters, still on the phone, locking the door,  beginning to punch the security code into the ALARM KEYPA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cellular)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-two Moore Street.  At the  corner of Moore and Buchanan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, sir, you said it was a break- in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure they're gone... ? As Nicholas finishes the security code, the KEYPAD BEEPS, and Nicholas straightens, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... are you sure there's not still  someone somewhere in the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... don't think so. And with the DYING HUMMMMMMMM of POWER FAILING, all the B LIGHTS GO OUT.  Nicholas raises his gun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God... Pointing it into the dark kitchen, hand trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?  Are you still there? Behind, a DARK FIGURE outside rises against the kitchen d window, POUNDING FRANTICALLY!  Nicholas leaps and spins,  CRYING OUT in terror, dropping the gun... The gun bounces across the linoleum. It's CONRAD at the kitchen door, haggard and scared, his  pale face pressed against the glass, pointing frantically

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet me out front! Conrad ducks away, moving on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bentley takes a corner fast, heading downhill, moving from residential to mostly urban...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BENTLEY
dialogues.text: Nicholas drives.  Conrad looks back over his shoulder, a on the run, dark circles under his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me where we're going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just drive, man. (slumps low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fucking nuts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this all about, Connie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhhhhh.  Wait... wait... Conrad flips the sunshade, looks behind it, feels the fab of the roof and the seam of the door. He grips the interior LIGHT, breaks it open, pulling the  bulb and wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're methodical.  They're nothing  if they're not that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.R.S.  Who do you think?  Jesus H.,  thank your lucky charms.  To think  what I almost got you into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (miserable)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, almost...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dodged a bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you mean, exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fuck you and they fuck you and  they fuck you.  And then, just when  you think it's done, that's when the  real fucking begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down, take a breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't stop, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I paid the bill, I gave 'em their  money, but it all started again.   They won't leave me alone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have they been doing to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything.  I'm a goddamn human- pinata...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down.  Why would they keep  playing after you paid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I know?  I paid them more  to make it stop. BOOM! -- the wheel jerks in Nicholas' hand, TIRES SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell... !?

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: A TIRE'S BLOWN OUT.  Riding the rim, the car jerks over..

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BENTLEY
dialogues.text: Nicholas stops at the curb.  Conrad's turned in his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's them.  They did this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a flat tire.  That's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to figure this out.  Get  a grip on yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... okay. Conrad faces forward.  Nicholas gets out to look at the w using his cellular, then returns to the open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how to change a tire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Do you? (off Nicholas' frown)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't be too hard, can it?  I don't  think we should be here out in the  open like this. Nicholas rubs his temples, looks all around, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check the glove box... might be  another battery there. Conrad OPENS the glove compartment: KEYS SPILL OUT.  At l fifty, silver and gold, all stamped "C.R.S." Conrad's breath catches in his throat.  He looks to Nicho afraid.  Nicholas leans closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did those... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're part of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Connie... Conrad climbs out, pointing across the roof of the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  You're one of them.  Of course,  it makes perfect sense!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it doesn't!  Those keys were put  there.  I didn't even know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're behind this, aren't you?  You  and your sick friends.  Well, make  it stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to yourself.   Why would I do  anything like what you're describing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you hate me.  Because you  had to be here, when mom died.   Because you had to do it alone. (near tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't you think if I'd known... I'd've been here too.  I'd have been  here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop this.  It's not true...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Christ, I'm sorry!  How  many more times do I have to say I'm  sorry before you forgive me... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! Conrad bolts away, full tilt, into a nearby PARK and PUBL GARDENS.  Nicholas gives chase, calling after. AHEAD, Conrad runs headlong, disappearing thru thick bush Nicholas follows, downhill, falls and slides, gets up.  A the bottom, he shoves thru vegetation... On the other side, Nicholas looks all directions, gulping air.  Conrad's nowhere to be seen.  Nicholas stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie! Far off, there's a concrete path winding thru the park pa a BANK OF PAYPHONES.  ONE PAYPHONE starts RINGING.  Nicho starts back the way he came. Behind, ALL THE PAYPHONES start RINGING.  Nicholas halts. He runs to the phones, answers one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sons-of-bitches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flippy?  Is Flippy there?  Flippy? Nichols slams the phone down, picks up another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'd like to make a call, please  hang up and... PHONE STOP RINGING.  Nicholas hangs up, digging out his  wallet.  Rifling thru it, he comes up with the VALET TICK with the C.R.S. EMERGRENCY 800-NUMBER on it.  He dials... Puts the phone to his ear.  BUSY SIGNAL.  He slaps the he tongue, redialing, waiting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're sorry.  The number you have  dialed has been disconnected or is  no longer in service... He throws the receiver, tears the valet ticket in half an tosses it, then steps back -- KICKS the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas returns to his car, looks down at the flat tire. At the rear, Nicholas opens the trunk.  He reaches in and takes out the car's JACK.  He looks at it like an alien t turns it over, tosses it into the street. He closes the trunk, REMOTE's the ALARM, walking away. There's a TAXI heading this way.  Nicholas hails it...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TAXI
dialogues.text: Nicholas gets in.  GLASS separates him from the CAB DRIVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-two Moore Street. The driver nods and hits the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taxi roars down the street.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TAXI
dialogues.text: Nicholas has his head back, eyes closed, loosening his ti He looks out the window, narrow his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... you want to turn here... (TAXI KEEPS GOING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, you missed the turn. The driver says nothing.  Nicholas knocks on the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear me?  You're... Nicholas stops, noticing the DRIVER I.D. on the other sid of the partition.  "California Regal Sedans."  C.R.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... no, no, no.  Stop the car! The taxi HALTS at a LIGHT.  Nicholas tries the DOOR HANDL Doesn't work.  He tries the WINDOW HANDLE -- it COMES OFF

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The cab PEELS OUT as the light turns green.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TAXI
dialogues.text: Nicholas tries the other door, panicky.  Same results -- locked in.  The taxi makes a SCREEEEECHING TURN...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The taxi speeds up... heading for a WHARF AREA and PIERS.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TAXI
dialogues.text: Nicholas presses against the partition, urgent, calm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen.  I am a very wealthy man.   Whatever they're paying you, I'll  double it! The taxi driver simply opens his door and leaps out... THRU THE WINDOW: the driver ROLLS, a perfectly executed s fall.  Nicholas can't believe.  He grabs frantically for seatbelt, SNAPS it around him, looks up... Opens his mouth to SCREAM...
The taxi goes FLYING off a deserted pier... airborne... SPLASHES DOWN! in the San Francisco Bay.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TAXI
dialogues.text: Nicholas is jerked forward, breath slammed out of him.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SURFACE OF THE WATER
dialogues.text: The taxi goes under in an eruption of bubbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THRU THE TAXI WINDOW: Nicholas pulls off his seatbelt,  extricates himself and starts kicking the window.  Dashbo lights grow eerie as they submerge.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TAXI
dialogues.text: Nicholas stops kicking, trying to calm.  He looks to the  front: water's gushing in through two-inches of open wind The taxi's less that half full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a game... it's a game... He tries the DOOR HANDLE again, yanking, to no avail.  He realizes something, searches his pockets...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taxi sinks, headlights dimming in murkier depths.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TAXI
dialogues.text: Nicholas finds the METAL CRANK.  He takes a deep breath.. SUBMERGING.  He puts the crank in the WINDOW HANDLE HOLE, turns the crank.  The WINDOW LOWERS, water flooding in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas swims out the window, heading upwards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas bursts to the surface, sucking air.  He treads w catching his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, mister... are you alright?
Nicholas turns.  There's a CABIN CRUISER docked nearby. beautiful GIRL in a yellow raincoat throws a life preserv Nicholas swims to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas climbs the rear ladder with the girl's help.  He stays on his knees, teeth chattering.  The boat's luxurio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could get hepatitis from that  water. She helps Nicholas up, keeps a grip on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get you dried off first.  I  might have some clothes below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shower and mirrors are fogged.  Nicholas' wet clothin sits in the sink.  He's wearing a short-sleeved shirt, pu on trousers.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ADJOINING BEDROOM
dialogues.text: QUIET MUSIC.  Nicholas comes from the bathroom, feeling t waistband of the pants, checking out the cuffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, these fit... perfectly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were my husband's.  My late  husband... may he rest in peace. Nicholas looks to the girl.  She rises from the bed and s the raincoat off, wearing only a BIKINI.  A Playmate. Nicholas just sort of sags. The girl undoes her top, which falls.  She steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been so lonely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you how not interested  I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be nervous.  They said you'd  be nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take another step. The girl covers her breasts, confused.  Nicholas gathers clothing from the sink, heading for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't this what you like?  They told  me you had a thing for boats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First they try to kill me, now you? (to girl)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your damn clothes back on. Nicholas scrambles upstairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas leaps off onto the wharf.  The girl, pulling on raincoat, crosses to the boat's rail, waving a BOX.  Thru the box's window: a gold GLASS CUTTER nestled in velvet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want your thing?  I was  supposed to give you this thing. Nicholas just keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO POLICE CARS, marked and unmarked, pull to the curb. From the plainclothes car, MALE DETECTIVE and FEMALE DETE get out.  Nicholas and Sutherland get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas, Sutherland, Male and Female Detective cross the busy lobby with TWO UNIFORMED OFFICERS behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas enters, followed by the others.  He stops short. REVEAL: this huge room, once filled with cubicles far as eye could see, is now entirely EMPTY.  Trash.  Dust.
Fixtures jutting from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas stands with hands in pockets, staring at the flo Sutherland's here.  Female and Male Detective stand toget She's checking notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Management for the building says  that space hasn't been officially  rented yet.  The county recorder has  no listing for "Consumer Recreation  Services" or any derivation thereof.   No sign of the boat or the girl.   We're checking escort services, but  it's unlikely.  Divers are looking  for the taxi, and soon as they find  it they'll pull the plates and V.I.N.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you gotten in touch with your  brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hasn't called back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The graffiti was painted in an oil- based marine marking solution.   Illegal in the states.  Not impossible  to trace, but it'll take time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The photos, gun, the clown, the  ambulance, cable box, everything  else... it's all pending. (shuts notebook)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breaking and entering we have, solid.   Malicious mischief, vandalism,  harassment.  But, that's about all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Illegal surveillance, reckless  endangerment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attempted murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except... you said you hired these  people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's irrelevant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our job to let you know what we  have.  We haven't got motive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nicholas)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are who you are, so we know you're  not making it up.  But, we've never  dealt with anything quite like this.   Be appropriately cautious. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you think they're done with  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 99   INT.  VAN ORTON MANSION, KITCHEN -Г‘ NIGHT Ilsa sets down a plate: sandwich with crust cut off, pota chips and carrot sticks.  Nicholas eats, pondering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was my father like? Ilsa's at the fridge, near where drop-cloths, paint cans other repair preparations are piled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure. Ilsa comes to set down a glass, fills it with milk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the time I've known you, you've  never once asked about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He came to my mind recently, that's  all. Ilsa moves to put food back into the refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother thought he was a good  man.  He worked very hard.  What I  remember most was his manner was  so... slight.  It was easy to spend  time in a room, and not realize he'd  been there the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he morose, or...?  I mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  What happened... no one expected  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I wonder how much of him  there is in me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much, I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not like him at all.  I don't  know exactly what's going on around  here lately, but don't make me start  worrying about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you worry about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody worried about your father. Nicholas stares at his milk.  PHONE RINGS.  He answers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Maria.  I found the address you  wanted from Elite Taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picks up pen and  paper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rows of lower-middle-class homes.  Nicholas parks.  A WHI VAN sits near, a wrench-wielding WORKMAN painted on the s "Cable Repair Specialists." Nicholas crosses the lawn of a WHITE HOUSE, to the porch. He rings the doorbell and waits.  Finally, an older man i bathrobe answers, CHRISTINE'S DAD, puffy-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.  Is Christine in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it, dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christine looks down from the top of the stairs.  Below,  Nicholas looks up past Christine's dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, dad. Christine's dad opens the door and heads away.  Christine comes down, in a pajama top and shorts, pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't think I'd ever see you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here... He watches to make sure dad's gone, leads Christine to th middle of the room, takes out a PHOTOCOPY, unfolds it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can you tell me about this? The SEX PHOTO of the woman in the RED BRA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was left in my hotel room, well,  not really mine.  You're saying it's  not you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I would remember. (hands it back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think it's me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... the red bra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like he's crazy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought... He's at a loss, drained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind if I sit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  You alright?  Is this still  that contest you're in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired.  I'm sorry, I should go.   I've been enough of a nuisance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go get some clothes on.  We'll  talk, okay?  Be right back. Christine hurries upstairs.  Nicholas stands, calls after

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any aspirin? Nicholas takes in the room, unhappy.  He squints at a VIR MARY figurine, picks it up... unscrews the head.

It's a decanter.  He sniffs it and puts it back.  He snif the air, noticing... A WISP OF SMOKE rises from a bright LAMP. INSIDE THE LAMPSHADE: Nicholas peers inside.  A PRICE TAG dangles against the bulb, turning brown, smoking. Nicholas reaches to remove the tag -- burns his finger on the bulb, jerking his hands away.  He blows on his finger sighs, walks to poke his head thru a swinging door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Modest, cluttered.  Nicholas goes to the sink, holds his  finger under the faucet.  NO WATER.  He jerks the faucet  handle, but gets nothing.  He looks around... Opens a drawer -- EMPTY.  He opens another drawer -- EMPT He opens more EMPTY DRAWERS, a disturbing thought forming Opens a cabinet -- EMPTY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas returns, scanning the room.  He picks up a FRAME PHOTO of a LITTLE GIRL in a dress, takes the frame apart. The picture is an ADVERTISEMENT from a glassy magazine, w TEXT folded behind and print on the back. Nicholas takes a breath, quickly replaces the clipping ju as Christine returns from upstairs.  She's in a pull-over dress, putting her hair up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want anything to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up frame)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  First Communion.  Aren't I a  little angel? Nicholas offers the frame to Christine, fury showing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the picture out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the picture out of the frame  and show it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't... Christine tries to assess the situation... realizes he's  onto her.  She swallows, making a quick decision, drops h facade, her voice a desperate WHISPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here!  They can see. Christine motions with her eyes.  Nicholas looks... ON THE CEILING, a red-bulbed SMOKE DETECTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheery, in character)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what do you say we go for a drive?   We'll take your car... She takes his hand and pulls him.  Nicholas yanks away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  I'm sick of this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas... Nicholas points up at the smoke detector, addressing it..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can come out now, if you're there.   Come on out!  Let's go! Nicholas walks to the fireplace, picks up a FIREPLACE POK He moves to SWING it up -- SWATS the smoke detector. Christine runs to the picture window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you've done it!
THRU WINDOW: THUG 1 and THUG 2, muscle men, climb out fro the CABLE REPAIR VAN, running this direction. Nicholas comes to look, poker in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Oh, and I suppose they're  going to... THRU WINDOW: Thug 1 and 2 draw guns, pointing... Nicholas furrows his brow, unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down! WINDOW'S BLOWN IN by GUNFIRE! as Christine tackles Nichol Shattered glass showers down.  KNICK-KNACKS FLY TO PIECES Christine crawls.  Nicholas follows.  They flee, Nicholas gasping and glancing back, terrified...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Christine pulls Nicholas thru a door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christine and Nicholas come downstairs to the empty garag Christine's Dad looks up from his solitaire game at a car table, a day player thrown off by this backstage intrusio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell... !? Christine leads Nicholas out the REAR DOOR... 105   EXT.  CHRISTINE'S BACKYARD -Г‘ NIGHT They run along the back of the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, wake up, it's a con! Around the corner, toward the front, Christine stops, loo across the front lawn to Nicholas' Bentley.

106   INT.  CHRISTINE'S GARAGE -Г‘ NIGHT Thug 1 and 2 bluster in, guns up.  Christine's dad points the open rear door, afraid.  Thug 1 thinks quick -- SLAMS the GARAGE DOOR OPENER... The OPENER'S MOTOR RATTLES to life, GARAGE DOOR RISING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas and Christine speed away in the Bentley. BEHIND, Thug 1 and 2 crawl under the garage door, giving  chase, FIRING.  Too little, too late.  They run to the va

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bentley roars onwards...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BENTLEY
dialogues.text: Nicholas drives, white-knuckled.  Christine watches behin

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The van pursues, far behind, but closing ground.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BENTLEY
dialogues.text: Nicholas checks his mirror.  Christine looks forward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The Bentley SIDESWIPES another CAR as Nicholas runs a lig The Bentley keeps going, the other car SPINNING... The van BRAKES HARD to avoid the spun-out car.  The van  reverses, angling to get around...

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER ON
dialogues.text: The Bentley SKIDS into an alley, lights off, still moving The van, having lost half a block, misses this and contin straight, raging forward, then SCREEEEECHING to stop... In the middle of a four-way intersection, stumped.  The v chooses a direction, cutting a corner, roaring away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... they're gone... She's thrown forward as Nicholas SLAMS BRAKES.  He reache across and throws Christine's door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could've handed you to them.  They  find me now, I'm dead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of my car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a choice.  No one  else is going to tell you what's  going on. Nicholas stares at her with hatred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to know?  If I'm gone,  you never will. Nicholas flips the headlights on, puts the car in gear an drives.  She pulls the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can talk while I drive us to the  police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No cops.  I've got a warrant out.   Mail fraud.  They'll take me in, but  you won't be able to prove anything  else. Christine takes out cigarettes, lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe they didn't take the  time to get the house right. Nicholas grabs the cigarette, throws it out his window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are "they?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, nobody does.  I'm an  employee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, what good are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know things... like who you can  trust.  Like that your brother was  in on it from the beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  I was your waitress on your  birthday.  Connie told you about  C.R.S. that day, remember?  I was  already playing my part, before you  started the game. Nicholas looks to her, realizing the truth of it. Christine's lighting up a new cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't his fault.  He thought it  was his only way back.  They fleeced  him real good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?  How could they have gotten  anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They did the same to him as they did  to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about... ? She gives him a pitying look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've already got it, Nicholas.   They got everything. Nicholas shoots her a glance; this is absurd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check your accounts.  That night in  your office, when we were there...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Christine runs her finger down Nicholas' TELEPHONE.  She  looks to see Nicholas is preoccupied, lifts the receiver. Reads the PHONE NUMBER underneath.  She turns, looks down There's a NUMBER written on the PHONE JACK on the wall: #

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the number to your private  line and modem.  I gave C.R.S. remote  access to your computer...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: NICHOLAS' C.R.S. TESTING: Nicholas' hand scribbles his  SIGNATURE... fills out a FINANCIAL QUESTIONNAIRE.  A TAPE RECORDER'S REEL SPINS... a PENCIL blackens TEST BLOCKS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You already gave them everything  else.  Handwriting, voice samples,  psych-info.  They used it all to  figure out your passwords. FLASHBACK: ON A MONITOR, combinations of LETTERS and NUMB SCROLL BY, multiplying, too quickly for the eye to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From there, they only had to keep  you distracted while they broke into  the network and transferred your  holdings to dummy accounts. FLASHBACK: FIGURES appear on a COMPUTER SCREEN; HIGH NUMB flying down to 000,000,000's.  More NUMBERS, falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember Jim Feingold, the guy who  signed you up?  He did five years  for hacking Citibank in eighty-four... FLASHBACK: PAN UP from deft fingers at a keyboard to JIM  FEINGOLD, lit by cold COMPUTER SCREEN GLOW.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE IN BENTLEY
dialogues.text: Nicholas sweats.  He checks his watch, takes out his cell dialing with his thumb.  Christine smokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why else would they be willing to  put you under... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cellular)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overseas operator?  Please dial  Allgemeine Bank, Zurich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't care about you anymore.   Alive or dead is the same, as long  as they bury you deep enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bentley SPEEDS out a tunnel on the highway toward S.F

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cellular)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guten tag.  Vilen dank, Englisch. Blue-two-backslash-five.  Mother's  maiden name: Miller.  Six-nine-zero,  D as in David.  Yes.  The balance... (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's impossible.  When did... ? Nicholas listens, scarcely breathing.  Christine seems  regretful.  Nicholas lowers the phone, shuts it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got everything. Lights flash across Nicholas' sweaty features.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas pumps gas, pale, on his cellular.  Christine sta across the lot, out of earshot, watching the dark freeway

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cellular)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call soon as you get this message,  Sam.  I checked them all, I don't  know how, but they drained my  accounts.  Now they're trying to  kill me.  You tell the cops, I've  got one with me.  We'll make her  testify.  I know how it must sound.   Call on my mobile.  Be careful

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FEMALE CLERK taps a gold credit card, listens on a PHON She hangs up, goes to the BULLETPROOF WINDOW.  Nicholas a Christine wait on the other side with armloads of food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say I have to take the card. Nicholas seems numb.  Christine checks her pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (via intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I've got some cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bentley overtakes a logging TRUCK on this dirt road.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BENTLEY
dialogues.text: QUIET NEWS RADIO.  Nicholas drains coffee from a styrofoa cup, rolls his window and tosses the cup out, trying to s awake.  He looks beside him. Christine's asleep against her door, placid and innocent- looking.  Nicholas stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful lake.  Dense forest.  The Bentley's parked near relatively humble CABIN.  LIGHTNING FLASHES across the sk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIRE in the fireplace.  Christine tends a metal pot over flames.  Nicholas sleeps slumped in a low chair.  Christi passes with the pot.  Nicholas awakens, disoriented, sear for familiarity.  He sits forward... Christine's in the candle-lit kitchenette.  He watches he grim.  She makes coffee.  He sits back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Christine comes over and gives him a mug of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say anything. He gets up, walks, sipping coffee.  Christine watches him Nicholas stares at FAMILY PHOTOS on the mantle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sad, unsure)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's not Christine.  It's not  my real...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck cares? He doesn't even look at her, picks up a PHOTO: FATHER and YOUNG NICHOLAS, holding up fish.  Nicholas rubs the dust his father's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just money.  You should be glad  you're alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might be best if we didn't talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I mean is... someone like you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many times have you done this?   I'm interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scams, con games.  How many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  A lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever kind of nickel-and-dime  shit you did before, this is more  than just me.  Your friends raided  pension plans, and payrolls... they  took just over six-hundred million.   You ruined people's lives. Christine looks sick and truly scared.  The CELLULAR CHIR
Nicholas goes to pick it up off a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cellular)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from cellular)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got your message.  I was disturbed,  to say the least... Christine stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cellular)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from cellular)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been on the phone for an hour  already.  Nicholas, your funds are  intact.  Nothing's been touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried, insistent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still into cellular)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?  I checked them  myself.  I made the calls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's changed.  I'm telling you,  not a cent is unaccounted for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cups phone, to  Christine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lawyer... says nothing's missing. She shakes her head ominously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fear, whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in on it... Nicholas stares at Christine, trying to comprehend...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what's happening, but  stay where you are till I get to  you.  Give me your precise location...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sutherland's in on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come there.  Hold on, Nicholas,  I have another call.  Tell me where  you are. Nicholas lowers the phone, pushes DISCONNECT, afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get out of here. The PHONE CHIRPS again.  Nicholas looks at it, flicks a s on the side, silencing it.  He sits, sickened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did they get to him?  Why didn't  you tell me? She lights a cigarette, backing toward the kitchenette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm... I wouldn't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... what do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's out of your hands. He looks up, trying to figure.  His head lulls... He takes a breath, looks at his trembling hands.  Drugged He looks around, confused... spots the COFFEE CUP, realiz With a CRY of RAGE, he LUNGES toward Christine, but comes short, toppling a shelf, contents CRASHING DOWN... Nicholas rolls, pained, clutching his throat, taking air RASPING GULPS.  He crawls, swings his fist, slams a table

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cellular calls can be intercepted,  you know. Christine backs to avoid, hefts a heavy cooking POT in ca
She maneuvers, steps over him.  He grabs, blindly... She scoops up the dropped PHONE and crosses away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cigarette 'tween  lips)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All those calls you made, to B of A,  France, Switzerland... you were  talking to my people. (hits REDIAL on  cellular)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You filled the blanks.  Access codes,  passwords, stuff even your lawyer  didn't have -- but we have it now. Nicholas tries to stand, falls, clutching his gut, CRYING OUT in great pain, frothing at the mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over, Nicholas.  Goodbye. THE ROOM SPINS round and round, spinning OUT OF CONTROL.

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK
dialogues.text: BREATHING... then a STRUGGLE... POUNDING, KICKING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PARTICLE-BOARD LID SPLINTERS as Nicholas pounds his way out of a COFFIN, looking wildly around, eyes blood-shot.. A moldering MAUSOLEUM.  Light seeps thru cracked walls. Piles of rotten flowers.  Coffins.  Hundreds of flies. Nicholas gags on the air, climbing free and falling to th floor, legs weak.  He's in a WHITE SUIT, dazed and afraid There's a RED ROSE taped to his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pushing the plywood door of the MAUSOLEUM outward, Nichol tumbles into dawn light.  He's in a ramshackle GRAVEYARD. Tombs for miles.  Misty, tropical vegetation.  Third Worl Nicholas walks, trying to figure this.  He notices the re rose, pulls it off and throws it.  An OLD WOMAN sits at a grave with her rosary.  She watches Nicholas, emotionless

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I?  What is this place? The OLD WOMAN speaks SPANISH.  Nicholas stares blankly. seems to be asking questions.  Nicholas finally realizes  it's a foreign language, turns, walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A busy downtown street.  A sea of MEXICAN PEOPLE, many po Nicholas walks, caught in the flow of the crowd, JOSTLED, aimless.  The world's a NOISY BLUR around him. Nicholas pushes to the TRAFFIC JAMMED street, spotting a  POLICEMAN directing traffic, heads for him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer... officer... HORNS BLAST.  Nicholas comes to the officer, relieved...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you speak English?  I'm an  American. The policeman scolds Nicholas in SPANISH, shoos him away. Nicholas searches his empty pockets...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen... they took my wallet... (insistent, of himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: American.  I am an American citizen. The policeman shouts angrily, grabs Nicholas' arm.  Nicho reflexively pulls away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't understand, I'm an  American... The policeman unsheathes his baton -- STRIKES Nicholas. Nicholas hits the street, raising his arms in defense.  T policeman SWINGS AGAIN... Hits Nicholas' skull.  Nicholas runs, escaping thru traff The policeman curses after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot.  Nicholas sits on a bench, a dried blood trail down face, holding balled-up newspaper to his bleeding head. Others on the BUSY SIDEWALK don't even take notice of him Nicholas checks to see if he's clotted, tosses the newspa He watches traffic pass, sits forward, elbows on his knee staring at the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... fuck... Tears forming in his eyes.  He takes a deep breath, stops himself, swallowing back despair, deciding.  Determined.. He gets up and walks.  He picks up the pace, running. LONG SHOT: Nicholas running, across one street, down anot a strange sight in his filthy white suit.  Stopping now a then to ask questions of passerbys, moving on... FOLLOW: Nicholas continuing, stopping in a SHOP DOORWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to SHOPKEEPER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The embassy?  Please... the American  embassy, do you know it? No answer.  Nicholas continues, slowing.  Ahead down the  sidewalk, there's another MEXICAN COP, tough-looking. Nicholas hesitates, then, approaches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me... Buenos Diaz, I'm looking  for the United States embassy.  U.S.   embassy, please... pour favor? The cop seems angry, eyeing Nicholas' appearance, decidin The cop points down the street.  Nicholas heads away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  Thank you, sir. Nicholas runs.

dialogues.speaker: LATER DAY
dialogues.text: "Embassy of the United States of America, MEXICO CITY."

121   INT.  AMERICAN EMBASSY, OFFICE Г‘- DAY A secretary leads Nicholas in from a crowded hallway.  An American COUNSELOR rises from his small desk in his small office, shaking Nicholas' hand, taking PAPERWORK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, sit... Nicholas sits in a metal chair.  A fan blows, poor remedy the heat.  The counselor reads the paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister... (sees desk name plate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Patterson.  Some things have  happened... it's important that I... The counselor holds up his hand, still reading...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No money, no identification or  passport.  You are in a fix. (looks up from papers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did happen to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, where to begin.  It's  complicated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter of fact)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It always is. Nicholas looks to the counselor, who sips a glass of wate and looks at papers.  Nicholas takes a moment, rethinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened was, I'm on vacation,  alone... I was robbed, at gunpoint.   They hit me and ran.  Two men, a few  blocks away.  They took my wallet,  money... all of it.  So...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you gone to the police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't speak Spanish.  All I need  is to get back... just enough for  that. The counselor taps his finger on desk's edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll help with the police, if you  want to bother.  As far as money  goes... can I make a suggestion? (off Nicholas' nod)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say you were mugged?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, they didn't take that watch? Nicholas looks at the ROLEX he's wearing, didn't realize till now, having taken it for granted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is it?  A few thousand, at  least.  A Rolex like that... lucky  for you they missed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, very lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSCRIBED on the back of Nicholas' ROLEX: "On your 18th  birthday, your father's watch.  Love, Mother" The FEMALE OWNER examines the Rolex inside a rusty metal  cage, makes a face.  Nicholas is at the front of the long line in this impossibly cluttered pawn shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cincuenta dolares Americano.  Fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty?  Do you know... (deep sigh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Rolex.  It's gold.  Not gold  colored, actual gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si, oro.  Cincuenta y cinco. Cincuenta y cinco Estados Unidos. Nicholas runs his hands thru his hair... resigned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, all you had to do was get  in the ballpark.  Yes, fifty-five...  si, senorita. The owner counts battered dollar bills from a cigar box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
