dialogues.text: At a faltering TACO STAND painted in peeling orange paint Nicholas pays for tacos wrapped in paper and a bottle of  Budweiser.  A bus ticket sticks out his breast pocket. Nicholas steps away, wolfing down the food, following it  with guzzled beer.  MANY PEOPLE are waiting for the bus, and around benches, suitcases and belongs in piles. Nicholas looks, still chewing, to THREE YOUNG MEXICAN CHI staring at him.  They stand with their plump MOTHER, just watching him.  Nicholas faces away, eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A repainted SCHOOL BUS zooms past, trailing exhaust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not one empty seat.  At the back, Nicholas' eyes flutter  under their lids.  He SNORES QUIETLY.  The MOTHER of the  three Mexican children is next to him, one child in her l She's asleep, leaning toward Nicholas.  The child's awake The bus shifts, GEARS GRINDING, and mother slides further over till her head rests on Nicholas' shoulder.  Nicholas awakens, looking at Mother against him. The child looks up at Nicholas.  Nicholas looks at the ch Nicholas puts his head back, closes his eyes. After a moment, the bus jerks and Nicholas opens his eyes turning to look out the window, watching a far-reaching  SUNSET.  Crimson and gold clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 126   EXT.  MEXICO/UNITED STATES BORDER -Г‘ NIGHT In the line of vehicles at the U.S. BORDER, the BUS' BRAK HISS, doors swinging open for an AMERICAN BORDER OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BORDER OFFICER comes on, not a calming presence.  The Mexican passengers know what to do, holding up GREEN CARD and PASSPORTS for perusal... The officer grunts at each passenger he approves, moving Nicholas slides lower in his seat.  Mother, beside him,  produces her GREEN CARD and holds it aloft, waiting. The officer comes to glare at Nicholas. Nicholas looks back at him, unblinking. The officer looks to Mother's card.  He says something in SPANISH.  Mother responds in SPANISH.  The officer grabs card, speaking, dissatisfied. He shouts for Mother to get off... hurrying her up, movin her out... Mother moves, carrying the child in her lap, hastening th other two children seated in front of her. Mother protests about her rope-bound SUITCASES in the ove shelf, trying to grip one, arms full of child.  The offic pulls her along, ignoring... Nicholas watches.  He rises...

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE BUS
dialogues.text: Mother and three children are unloaded.  The official wav the bus on to the border, despite Mother's protest. The bus sets in motion... AT THE BACK OF THE BUS, the rear emergency door is forced open.  Nicholas is there, dropping one suitcase... Following with a second suitcase, tossing it to the groun gently as the bus' motion allows.  Mother spots this, mov to collect the suitcases, children following...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BUS
dialogues.text: The BUS DRIVER shouts a complaint in SPANISH. At the rear, Nicholas pulls the door shut and latches it, watching thru the window as Mother and children drag thei suitcases out of the path of other vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas walks backwards, exhausted, hitchhiking on the  freeway shoulder.  TRAFFIC absolutely SOARS PAST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Highway in the b.g., Nicholas hikes across the parking lo of this 24-hour DINER, past many parked TRACTOR TRAILERS. 130   INT.  BOB'S BIG BOY RESTAURANT -Г‘ NIGHT There's a heavy duty TRUCK DRIVER clientele elbow to elbo at the counter, eating, drinking coffee.  The BELL above door TINKLES as Nicholas enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me... Nicholas moves to the end of the counter, louder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, please, if I could have  your attention... Conversations stop.  Everyone looks to Nicholas.  He's  scruffier than ever; a hobo freak in a white suit, fed up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  If anyone's heading to  San Francisco, I need a ride. Met with silence.  Nicholas clears his rough throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's... (digs in pockets)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's all the money I've got left  in it for you... eighteen dollars  and seventy-nine cents... Nicholas puts his crumpled bills and coins on the counter One penny falls.  You can hear it hit the floor and roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRIGHT DAY.  A big, Baskin-Robbins TRUCK rumbles by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENGINE and ROADWAY ROARING.  Windows open, wind whipping.
Beside the DRIVER, Nicholas sleeps wrapped in a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Baskin-Robbin's tractor trailer keeps on truckin'. AHEAD: the San Francisco skyline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas climbs down from the Baskin-Robbin's truck, than the driver.  The truck lurches away.  Nicholas walks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gate is WRAPPED IN CHAINS.  Nicholas arrives, trudgin He pulls to test the chains.  There's a "PUBLIC AUCTION" SIGN hung.  Nicholas tears it down, begins climbing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ROCK SMASHES a glass pane in the door.  Nicholas reache thru to let himself in.  No electricity.  Graffiti's gone There's scaffolding.  Work in progress.  Appliances gone. Nicholas checks the PHONE, finds it dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas looks in.  Furniture's wrapped in thick plastic. Curtains and paintings are gone.  Like the kitchen, this  room's repainted.  Cold and bare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door's ajar.  Nicholas pushes it open slow, ent darkness.  The living room is completely empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling upstairs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ilsa. Pitch dark at the top of the stairs.  Nicholas moves forw into another EMPTY ROOM.  It's creepy quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas enters the moonlit garage.  THREE EMPTY SPACES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE SHOWER, Nicholas scrubs his hair with a bar of soa huddled under the cold spray, shuddering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the stripped bedroom, Nicholas, in a baggy t-shirt and jeans, pulls a paper wrapped package from a dresser.  On bed, he tears open the paper, pulling out a long OVERCOAT 142   INT.  MANSION, KITCHEN -Г‘ MORNING Dawn light.  BIRDS HEARD SINGING.  Nicholas opens drawers He finds a mason jar with CASH inside, unscrews the lid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving boxes.  Half the shelves of this impressive librar are emptied into high stacks of books on the floor. Nicholas moves to search a section still lined with books ... looking for one in particular, reading spines... "To Kill a Mockingbird" by Harper Lee, leather bound. Nicholas takes it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas heads for the front door.  He halts, noticing... An ENVELOPE on the counter, "TO WHOM IT MAY CONCERN." Nicholas opens the envelope, unfolding a letter... "Like father before me, I choose eternal sleep."  Still with th RED SIGNATURE ARROW affixed below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "suicide note" lands in the sink, BURNING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MINI BUS halts at a corner.  Nicholas is the second rid off, paranoid, book under his arm.
He moves down the sidewalk... toward the FOUR SEASONS HOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unkempt, unshaven Nicholas is a blight in this flawless h At the desk, he gets the CLERK'S attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to see Conrad Van Orton.   Ring his room. The desk clerk gives a pause while Nicholas scans the lob

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One moment, please... The desk clerk crosses to a gray, elder statesman MANAGER huddling to speak in hushed tones.  Nicholas watches them concerned.  The manager walks over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're here for Conrad Van Orton?   I'm the hotel manager... He offers a handshake which Nicholas ignores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleasure to meet you, I'd like to  see my brother, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worry, guiding  Nicholas)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother.  Will you come with  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a private matter, for you... I  think you'll be more comfortable...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my brother? The manager looks around, feeling indiscreet, voice low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were complaints by other guests,  and damage to his room.  We did the  best we could to accommodate his  behavior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His behavior... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He couldn't, or refused to pay.  We  extended credit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, where is he?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was an incident a few days  ago... a nervous breakdown, they  said.  The police took him.  They  left this address, in case anyone... Nicholas struggles to absorb this while the manager takes out a BILLFOLD of business cards, offers a SLIP OF PAPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a hospital in Napa.  I'm terribly  sorry.  If you'd have been here,  you'd have seen, there was nothing  else to do. Nicholas regards the paper, disbelieving, sorrow welling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELIZABETH, Nicholas' ex-wife, bends to kiss her young  DAUGHTER.  The daughter runs to a waiting, luxury MINI-VA The female driver waves as the van pulls away. Across this suburban street, Nicholas stands watching. Elizabeth is about to go back inside, but she sees Nichol She's surprised, smiling at first instinctively, but then she looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUSINESS PEOPLE chat over breakfast.  A TV at the bar sho GOOD MORNING AMERICA.  Nicholas and Elizabeth are seated  near.  He's edgy, fingering a spoon, hand on his book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your car, Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you, Nick?  I mean,  look at yourself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, look at me, well... (short laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?  I don't know.  I  don't even really know.  I have some  things to try to take care of... I  need the car a little while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you can have it if you  need it.  Can I get you something to  eat? She starts working the CAR KEY off her keychain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the only person I can trust.   Everyone else... (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Sam Sutherland calls, don't tell  him you saw me.  Lie to him.  And,  whatever you hear, whatever anyone  tells you when this is over... Nicholas straightens as a PALE WAITRESS arrives.  He stud her.  She notices his fixation, tries to ignore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serving...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There we go... coffee and English  muffin... water... (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, if there's anything... Nicholas picks up his bottled water, examining the broken plastic SAFETY SEAL around the cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is open.  Someone opened it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't have this open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gives it back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like another unopened.  And I  don't want ice.  I need a glass  without ice. The waitress leaves, glad to get away from this freak. Nicholas keeps looking all around the restaurant and over his shoulder.  Elizabeth takes Nicholas' hand, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, talk to me.  You're scaring  me.  I don't even know what you're  saying. He faces her, looks down at her hand in his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Liz... I don't mean to. Nicholas clasps her hand, caresses it, looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last few days, um... I've been  thinking... had a lot of spare time. (pause, sad)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to tell you... I'm starting  to understand why you left me.  I've  been resenting you for it, maybe,  but ... I want to apologize, for all  of it.  For shutting you out, for  not being there.  I... (swallows)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I hope you can forgive me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to forgive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would mean a lot to me... if you  and I could be friends.  If I could  have you back in my life... in some  small way.  It would be important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, Nick... Nicholas tries to smile.  He glances away for a second, a he lets out a STRANGLED CRY because he SEES SOMETHING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... no!
He stands, agonized, looking across to the... TELEVISION, where JIM FEINGOLD is ON SCREEN in C.U.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to television)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking bastard! ON TELEVISION: Feingold looks menacing, the top of his HE REDDENING and beginning to THROB.  CHEESY SOUND EFFECTS..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still to t.v.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you find me here?! Obviously, everyone's watching Nicholas, Elizabeth includ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ON TELEVISION)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, my head is killing me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from t.v., o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you take anything, sweetie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on television)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took aspirin, but it's not working! ON TV: a FEMALE HAND appears, offering a BOTTLE OF PILLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from television)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try Ambutol, you silly goose.  It's  stronger than aspirin and... Nicholas is starting to understand, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He... he's an actor... ON TV: Feingold, now cured, holds up the pills and smiles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks to Ambutol, I've got my head  back together. JINGLE MUSIC.  Nicholas looks to Elizabeth, points to t.v

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a t.v.  He's just an actor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Nicholas realizes how he must look.  He picks up the car  key, gives Elizabeth a kiss on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll explain someday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope. She watches Nicholas hurry away.  She sits forward, wonde shaking her head. NEAR THE CASH REGISTER, Nicholas moves to the door, but s He goes to the CASHIER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I borrow your Yellow Pages... ? The cashier digs under the counter, comes up with the PHO BOOK.  Nicholas takes it, leaving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Nicholas goes out the door, gone.  The cashier does a dou take, about to say something, confused, dour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A run-down neighborhood.  Nicholas drives Elizabeth's VOL erratically, distracted...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VOLVO
dialogues.text: He steers with one hand while paging thru the YELLOW PAGE open on the seat.  He gets to RESTAURANTS, trading glance between the book and the street.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Red light ahead.  The Volvo stops.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VOLVO
dialogues.text: Nicholas finds ads for CHINESE RESTAURANTS, running his f down, flipping the page.  His finger hits it -- a grinnin CARTOON PANDA.  "TUNG HOY Chinese Restaurant."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tung Hoy.  Tung Hoy... best in  Chinatown. He tears the page out and studies it like a pirate with a treasure map.  Suddenly, an arm reaches in thru the windo putting a KNIFE to Nicholas' throat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of the car, fucker... Nicholas holds still, eyes shifting to look at the wasted skittish TEEN THUG threatening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the door and climb out.  Leave  it running. Nicholas is twitchy calm, motionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're making a mistake... The knife presses harder against Nicholas' throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of the car, motherfucker!   Get out of the car... ! Nicholas' hand finds and opens the book "To Kill a  Mockingbird" beside him.  It's HOLLOWED-OUT with a GUN hi inside, a revolver, which Nicholas grips... Nicholas brings the gun across, into the thug's face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea how fragile I am  right now. The thug backs off... runs away.  Nicholas watches him go puts down the gun, drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A festive Chinatown neighborhood.  At "TUNG HOY," ducks h behind the CARTOON PANDA painted on the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cramped.  Walls covered in CELEBRITY HEADSHOTS.  Nicholas faces an OLD CHINESE WOMAN behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's an actor.  He does television  commercials...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how many customers we  have?  Hundreds.  Thousands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know he orders from you.  He had  his food delivered to Montgomery  Street.  Fifteen-thirty-three... The woman just shakes her head, continues bagging orders. Nicholas realizes it's futile.  He bends over the counter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anyone else I could ask?   Maybe they'll remem... Nicholas stops, eyes locked... Low on the wall, amongst the grease-browned pictures of p celebs, there's a newer GLOSSY OF FEINGOLD, smiling big,  labeled "William Fisher." Nicholas looks to woman who's shouting into the kitchen. jumps up on the counter, reaching with his fingertips for the "Feingold" PHOTO, straining, almost has it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a PAYPHONE, Nicholas looks at the BACK OF THE HEADSHOT credits, phone number -- flips it to show Feingold/Fisher

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I know it's short notice Mrs.  Fisher, but we were hoping your  husband could audition today.  He's  perfect for the part...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this will break his heart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there any way we can get in touch  with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His beeper's here on the table.  He  took the kids to the zoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The zoo.  How sweet.  Which zoo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANIMALS lounge in their cages.  TOURISTS wander, mostly  families.  Here comes Nicholas, running, searching... Ahead: Feingold's in casual clothes, eating ice cream, do his best to supervise THREE OBNOXIOUS CHILDREN.  Nicholas moves in, slows when he's close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill Fisher, I love your work... Feingold turns, smiling... till he sees Nicholas and  recognition sets in.  He goes pale, sheepish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, please.. I got my kids... Nicholas casually shows him the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get rid of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, everyone -- snack time!  Here...   here you go... Feingold takes out cash and dispenses it.  KIDS CHEER and run to a nearby SNACK CART.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it was just a job.  Nothing  personal, ya know?  I play my part,  improvise a little.  That's what I'm  good at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired of dealing with peons.  I  need to get to whoever's in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody knows, pal.  Nobody gets the  big picture... (looking away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason, Tommy, cut it out! His BOYS are THROWING ROCKS at the MONKEYS.  They look to their father, drop the rocks and saunter away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, why do they do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grips Feingold's  shirt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I find them?  Their offices  are empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They own the whole building.  They  just move from floor to floor. Nicholas releases him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They know you... you worked for them.   You can get me in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't.  I'm sorry and all,  but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them the cops are after you...   tell them you've got to talk to  someone, I'm threatening to blow the  whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What whistle?  There's no fucking  whistle.  This is fucking dangerous. Nicholas gets in Feingold's face, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't seem to understand.  Right  now -- I'm dangerous. Feingold gets the message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dusk.  LIGHTS OFF in the towering building.  A battered  STATION WAGON rounds a corner, PAUSES at the GARAGE RAMP.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE STATION WAGON
dialogues.text: Cluttered car.  Feingold at the wheel, tense, appears alo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here. BEHIND THE SEAT, Nicholas peeks from under a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do anyway?  You  won't get your money back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled, under blanket)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want money.  I'm pulling  back the curtain.  I'm here to meet  the wizard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station wagon comes down the ramp to a closed GATE. BEEFY GUARD looks from his booth.  Feingold waves timidly The GATE RISES and the station wagon moves on...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE STATION WAGON
dialogues.text: IN THE REARVIEW MIRROR: Beefy Guard watches, suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's eyeing us like Tiffany Towers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go.  Park where he can't see.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE UNDERGROUND GARAGE
dialogues.text: ACROSS THE GARAGE, near elevators, the station wagon park Feingold gets out, scared.  Nicholas climbs out, crouched gun in hand, points for Feingold to go first. Feingold goes to push the elevator button, sweating.
Nicholas remains hidden between cars. A few elevators down, ELEVATOR DOORS open and a fierce C. SECURITY GUARD gets off, spots Feingold, murmurs into a W TALKIE while taking out a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not allowed to be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they called me back... I have a  fitting... Behind, Nicholas puts his gun to the guard's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the gun. Security Guard gives it up, an automatic, which Nicholas  throws across the garage.  Nicholas forces the guard to t open elevator, takes the WALKIE-TALKIE and pockets it, pu Feingold along...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Nicholas frisks the Guard... pulls out HANDCUFFS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.  Cuff him to the rail. Feingold takes the handcuffs and obeys.  Nicholas jams th gun against the guard's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What floor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen.  But this elevator ain't  gonna get you there, college boy. Nicholas pulls off the guard's KEYCHAIN, sorts keys... He uses a GOLD C.R.S. KEY on the control pad, turns it an hits 14.  DOORS CLOSE.  The elevator sets IN MOTION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never get away with this.   These people will fuck you up. Nicholas ignores.  Feingold whimpers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELEVATOR OPENS.  Nicholas peers out.  No one in the hall. He pushes Feingold ahead, pushes ALL THE FLOOR BUTTONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fucked.  You're both... ELEVATOR SHUTS.  Nicholas and Feingold move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, they hired me over the  phone.  I never met anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you pick up your checks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a different floor then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like, this way... sort of... Nicholas nudges Feingold ahead with the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Door swings open.  Nicholas and Feingold enter... A BUSTLING, NOISY COMMISSARY.  A cafeteria counter along wall.  People CHATTING and LAUGHING at rows of long table Nicholas keeps a grip on Feingold, walks forward, stunned EVERYONE FROM THE GAME IS HERE: the PARAMEDICS eat with t HEAVY MAN who faked the heart attack.  CHRISTINE'S FATHER seated near the airport HOMELESS BUM, BIKINI GIRL and the MEXICAN MOTHER with her THREE CHILDREN from the bus. PLUMP GUY, the P.I. who followed Nicholas and had his gun taken, comes off the cafe line with a soda, spotting  Nicholas... spotting the gun, quaking.  He flees... Nicholas and Feingold continue.  BUSINESSMAN 1 and 2 from Nicholas' club sit near AMBULANCE ATTENDANTS.  The TAXI D and the FEMALE DETECTIVE chat.

There's the HOTEL MANAGER from the Claremont... the BELLH the CHINESE WOMAN from Tung Hoy... the DESK CLERK from th Four Seasons and TEEN THUG.  Every incidental character f Nicholas' recent life. Nicholas inches into the room.  A few of the players begi to notice him, some trying to place him, others pointing out to their dining partners.  Nicholas halts, sees... CHRISTINE rising, picking up her dirty tray, in mid- conversation till she turns and sees... Nicholas, who raises his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck... People notice the gun.  SOME SCREAM.  Everyone goes HUSHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm back from the dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas, okay... you're not about  to shoot anyone... Nicholas moves to grab Christine.  She drops her tray...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're coming with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody down! Nicholas spins.  At a far entrance, TWO SECURITY GUARDS a guns.  PEOPLE SCREAM.  Some run.  Many dive for cover. PANIC.  Nicholas gets behind Christine... He uses Christine as a shield, arm around her throat, pul her backwards.  Feingold's frozen, hands held high...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move! Nicholas glances at the door, moving for it, dragging  Christine.  Feingold's still got his hands up... Nicholas and Christine near the doors... Feingold bolts another direction, leaping tables...
Security Guard 1 shifts aim to Feingold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Security Guard 1 FIRES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas shoves out into the hall with Christine just as  GUNSHOTS ECHO behind.  MORE horrified SCREAMS HEARD and T TOPPLING and PLATES CRASHING. Nicholas shoves Christine ahead, searching desperately...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get us out of here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get us out! He shoves.  She falls.  He pulls her back up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter.  He makes her climb at gunpoint...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move, move, move! They climb stairs... up towards the "HELIPORT..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air ducts, etc.  A MUFFLED ALARM SOUNDS as Christine come out the door onto the windy rooftop, followed by Nicholas She backs against the railing the borders the huge BLACK at the center of the building; an atrium SKYLIGHT. Nicholas SLAMS the door, throws the HEAVY BOLT, searches make sure the rest of the roof is clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me... I want to know who's  behind this.  Who did this to me...   how, why... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How deluded can you be?  There's no  why...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's responsible?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't you.  It wasn't personal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call them... Nicholas pulls out the WALKIE-TALKIE, throws it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could have been any asshole with  a couple hundred million in the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call them, tell them to get the boss  up here.  Tell them I'll kill you... POUNDING is HEARD from the other side of the roof DOOR. MUFFLED VOICES.  Nicholas reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will!  You tell them if they  don't come now, I will shoot you! STATIC and GARBLED ORDERS HEARD from the WALKIE-TALKIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you... they'll let me  die first.  You're not in a position  to threaten them.  You're trapped.   You're the one who... Christine freezes, thrown...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... wait a minute... She's taking notice of the revolver Nicholas brandishes..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get that... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That gun.  That... that's not  automatic.  The guard had an  automatic... POUNDING is LOUDER against the nearby door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get that gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's mine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We searched the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess you missed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly very afraid)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just... wait.  Just wait!  Okay...   please, I'm not kidding anymore... Christine brings the WALKIE-TALKIE to her mouth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie-talkie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a gun.  Everyone, he's got  a real gun up here!  Real situation! (switching channels)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... damn it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas, this is fake.  It's all  part of the game...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. THUMP-THUMP-THUMP against the DOOR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen very carefully, I'm telling  the truth... this is the game.  This  was all the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.  They killed him.  Feingold,  Fisher, whoever... they shot him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, now wait... think about it.   What did you see... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw them kill him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you really see?  This whole  time... special effects, squibs,  like in the movies.  Please, you've  got to believe me... (into walkie-talkie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a gun, with real bullets!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop talking to them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... okay... (drops walkie-talkie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put it down.  Now open that door.   Mister Fisher's right on the other  side of that door.  He's an actor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop talking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me show you... She takes a step toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  You take another step, I'll  shoot!  They're trying to kill me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong.  You're about to make  the biggest mistake of your life.   Put that gun down. POUNDING on the DOOR is DESPERATE.  Nicholas falters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about it!  They followed you  every step of the way.  There was  always a safety net.  The taxi, there  was a diver.  At my house, the window  was rigged... they shot at us with  blanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is.  It's what you hired us for.   Nobody touched your money.  Nobody  stole anything.  They're waiting on  the other side of that door with  champagne... all your friends...  it's a celebration...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open that door, you'll see.  Your  brother's there... Conrad.  He's  there.  It's your birthday party...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Nicholas, let me show you... She takes a tentative step towards the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move, you bitch... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still moving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to show you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! And from the staticy WALKIE-TALKIE on the ground:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thru WALKIE-TALKIE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Take him down!  Take him down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts to door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a gun!
With a CLANK! -- the DOOR is POUNDED OPEN, swinging... Nicholas turns, aims at the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't! Nicholas FIRES, gunshot DEAFENING... ! In the doorway, Conrad, in TUXEDO and PARTY HAT, is start as the magnum of CHAMPAGNE he holds EXPLODES and throws f and glass in a wide spray... The smile falls from Conrad's face as BLOOD spreads acros his chest.  He looks to Nicholas, confused, collapsing... A collective cry of horror comes from the gaily dressed P GOERS behind as Feingold catches Conrad and eases him to ground, cradles him... Nicholas lowers his gun... realizing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie... Feingold clutches Conrad, trying to stop the bleeding, fe for a pulse.  Blood flows out Conrad's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... you shot him... ! (back to others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone call an ambulance! Conrad's eyes are closed.  He's motionless.  He's dead. Christine lets out a hysterical sob, hands to her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God... oh, God... Nicholas drops the gun, moves forward, stunned, numb...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead... he's dead... ! (to Nicholas)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed him! Nicholas falls to his knees in front of Feingold and Conr Christine's eyes fill with tears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nicholas)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?!  I told you... I told you.   Why didn't you listen? Feingold releases Conrad to the floor, rising, bloody...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to jail.  We're all going  to jail for the rest of our lives... People start clearing out of the stairwell, heading down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nicholas)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We thought you knew!  How could you  let this get so out of hand? Nicholas just remains kneeled there, breathing unevenly,  staring at his brother's corpse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why wouldn't you listen to me?  What  is wrong with you?  You killed your  own brother! Nicholas looks to the dark sky, tears streaming down his  face.  He looks all around. Christine stops, looking down at the corpse, crying out o control.  Feingold comes to attempt to comfort her. Nicholas gets to his feet, unsteady, backing away, lookin to the GLASS SKYLIGHT.  He wipes his tears. Nicholas stands motionless for the longest time.  Calm. Nicholas moves forward... a goal in mind... Christine turns, sees... Nicholas comes to the edge of the SKYLIGHT... Christine screams... Nicholas leaps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas CRASHES thru the SKYLIGHT, FALLING... SPARKLING SHARDS surround him like stars as he PLUMMETS..
The WORLD BELOW is PITCH DARK.  Nicholas turns in the air head thrown back, closing his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK/GRAINY HOME MOVIES
dialogues.text: QUICK IMAGES: the CLOWN, CHRISTINE'S FACE, NICHOLAS and C as children, Nicholas' FATHER striking the ground... IMAGES so RAPID they're hard to process.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: As Nicholas falls... FALLING forever... He lets out a CRY as the end rushes closer... BRILLIANT LIGHT suddenly illuminates him.  Nicholas throw his eyes open, gasping in the brightness... LIGHTS come on from all sides to show NICHOLAS' IMPACT as lands on his back, arms outstretched, SWALLOWED by an ENO INFLATED LIFESAVING CUSHION that covers the entire floor the atrium... AIR is HEARD RUSHING.  Nicholas sinks, coming to rest as cushion DEFLATES.  Harmless bits of BREAKAWAY GLASS showe down.  He doesn't move... He can't comprehend.  Motionless. DOORS are HEARD OPENING.  FOOTSTEPS RUSHING FORWARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... let's go! ... make sure he's  alright... see if he's okay... STUNT COORDINATORS come from all directions, in C.R.S.   jumpsuits, wading thru the flowing cushion, coming to hel Nicholas up, asking if he's okay.  Nicholas just blinks a them, quaking, lips trembling... He's led out of the cushion, barely standing, sees... Conrad runs from the elevators, covered in blood but very much alive, smiling... Conrad reaches Nicholas, throwing his arms around him, gi him a long kiss, laughing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday, Nickie.  Happy fucking  Birthday...
Conrad embraces him again, knocks him back into the cushi Nicholas is still not all there, pulling away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get... get off.  Get off me!!  You...  you... Nicholas shoves free, staring at Conrad, looking up, look back at Conrad, looking all around, terrified, near tears Emotion overwhelms Nicholas.  He laughs and cries at once takes Conrad in him arms, holding tight, hands balled int fists, clinging gratefully. ACROSS THE ATRIUM, DOORS OPEN and people flow out, cheeri Sutherland, Ilsa and Elizabeth at front, looking unsure,  forcing smiles, led by C.R.S. ESCORTS.  And behind, DOZEN and DOZENS of C.R.S. WORKERS, ASSISTANTS and TECHNICIANS. At the bank of ELEVATORS, DING, DING, DING... DOORS OPEN the CAST OF CHARACTERS EMERGES, Feingold leading, holding Christine's hand, everyone elated and shouting victorious The crowd encircles Conrad and Nicholas as they climb bac out of the cushion.  HUNDREDS of WELL-WISHERS gathering.. Conrad climbs a few stairs, pulls Nicholas along, motions

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen... (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My big brother... Nicholas Van Orton!   He had it all, and now he has it all  back! THUNDEROUS APPLAUSE.  Nicholas looks out over them, flush awed, unable to catch his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 163   INT.  C.R.S. BUILDING, ATRIUM/LOBBY -- TIME CUT -Г‘ LOUD MUSIC.  COCKTAIL PARTY IN PROGRESS.  A huge CAKE is  being cut.  Tables surround a PACKED dance floor area whe Feingold dances crazily.  Everyone's drinking, eating... IN THE CROWD, FIND: Nicholas stands with a bottle of cham in hand, watching Ilsa embrace Conrad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope we'll be seeing more of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Count on it. Ilsa reaches to straighten Conrad's hair.  She regards  Nicholas with affection, kisses his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight.  See you home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight. (watches her go, to  Conrad)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where was she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a hotel.  Ordering room service  and watching pay-per-view.  She was  a real sport. BUSINESSMAN 1 and HEAVY MAN come thru the crowd to Nichol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, congratulations!  You did  great... really kicked ass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing, just wanted to tell you... Nicholas thanks them, shaking hands as they move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Conrad)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know... how'd you manage the  gun? I mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, they were all over the house  with metal detectors.  They switched  your gun with a look-alike, rigged  barrel, loaded with blanks.  Pop- gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from behind)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Van Orton... ? Nicholas and Conrad both turn to face a C.R.S. ACCOUNTANT nebbish who holds a CLIPBOARD and gives an amused look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad Van Orton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... ? Conrad steps aside with the accountant.  Nicholas takes a swig off his champagne, nods in response to C.R.S. WORKER who slap his back as the pass. Nicholas realizes something, begins searching the crowd a Elizabeth arrives with HUSBAND and DAUGHTER hand in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to head out... just wanted  to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going?  Well, thanks again. (to DAUGHTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you, Rachel... (shakes HUSBAND'S  hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming, Mel.  I'll get  your car back.  Right now it's, uh...   at the zoo.  Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday, Nicholas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call.  I really will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. She kisses his cheek.  Nicholas waves as they go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye guys. Nicholas looks around, still searching.  He walks, receiv more random congratulations, heading to a table where  Sutherland sits puffing a cigar.  Nicholas sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravo, young man.  you have to tell  me what this was all about sometime. (blows cigar smoke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to know... when it looked  there for awhile like you were going  slowly insane... I was fully prepared  to have you committed to the finest  mental-health facility available.  I  mean that sincerely, don't thank me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You warm my heart. Sutherland smiles, raises his glass.  Conrad deposits him in a seat, holding an inch-and-a-half thick stack of COMP PAPER, studies the last sheet, thumbs the pages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This... ?  Oh, this is just... this  is the bill. Conrad tries to laugh, daunted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (none too happy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Split it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God yes please.  Thanks, man.   I'll take you up on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leans forward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Christine? (off Conrad's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waitress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah.  She called a cab. Said something about catching a plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she? Nicholas looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas comes out of the building to the street, hurryin without wanting to appear hurried, looks both ways.  Down the block, a TAXI arrives.  Christine's getting in. Nicholas runs to catch it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me... Christine... ! She looks out, waiting with the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  Didn't get a chance to say  goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my fault.  I get too worked  up at these.  I'm very method.  You  do know... that's not my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know what else to call you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire.  Pleased to meet you. He holds out his hand.  She shakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get to the airport...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going in such a hurry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's another gig starting in Saudi  Arabia.  I'm just a walk-on this  time though.  Bit-part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about dinner sometime, when you  get back?  Would that be... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this something you're interested  in?  I'm not really that person I  was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realize.  Maybe you could... tell  me a little about yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what... my favorite color... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like... where are you from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Originally, Connecticut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big family... small?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One brother, one sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Studied acting, I assume?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julliard, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Single?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Underwear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always. Nicholas nods, scratches his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could learn to live with that. Christine smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See how much I've learned already.   Imagine how much more I could learn  if you let me keep you company to  the airport. She considers. She moves over.  Nicholas gets in beside her, shuts the d The cab drives away, into the nighttime city.
